title: Marine Technician
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a skilled Mercury/ Yamaha/ Suzuki Marine Technician to join our team, responsible for the maintenance and repair of various marine vessels. The ideal candidate will possess strong mechanical knowledge and hands-on experience with power tools, welding, and sheet metal work. This role requires a detail-oriented individual who can effectively troubleshoot issues and ensure the optimal performance of marine equipment.

**Duties**

* Perform routine maintenance and repairs on marine vessels, including engines, electrical systems, and hulls.
* Utilize power tools and welding equipment to execute repairs and modifications.
* Conduct inspections to diagnose mechanical issues using calipers and other measuring tools.
* Maintain accurate records of service performed and parts used during repairs.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure timely completion of projects while adhering to safety standards.
* Provide exceptional customer service, including explaining technical issues and solutions to clients.
* Assist in sales efforts by recommending services or upgrades based on customer needs.

**Skills**

* Proficient in mechanical knowledge related to marine systems and equipment.
* Experience as a service technician with a solid understanding of troubleshooting techniques.
* Ability to operate power tools safely and effectively for various repair tasks.
* Skilled in welding and working with sheet metal for fabrication or repair purposes.
* Familiarity with calipers and other precision measuring instruments for diagnostics.
* Strong communication skills to interact with customers and team members effectively.
* A proactive approach to problem-solving with attention to detail in all tasks performed.

Join our team as a Marine Technician where your skills will contribute significantly to the satisfaction of our clients while ensuring the reliability of their marine vessels.

As our industry continues to grow, Shiptronics is growing even faster. Do you love your career? Are you growing and learning daily? Are you comfortable punching a clock and not being recognized for your achievements? If you answered “no”, good news! You need to come work for us. Shiptronics is the fastest growing marine electronics company in the country and we are seeking experienced installers and technicians in our Naples, Sarasota and St Pete Divisions.

Requirements:

\\*Must have a valid drivers license and be insurable.  
\\*Must have good communication skills to be able to contact and speak with owners, captains, dealers and operators to gather and provide data  
\\*Time management and multi tasking skills and the ability to prioritize  
\\*Travel may be required at times  
\\*Must agree to a background check  
\\*We work in warm environments at times (engine rooms)  
\\*Must be able to work in small spaces and confined environments like bilges and aboard a variety of boats/vessels; this includes climbing up and down ladders, bending, leaning, stooping, lying down, working in warm environments and other challenging conditions.  
\\*Must be able to lift 70+ lbs  
\\*Complete assigned work in a timely, efficient, and professional manner.  
\\*Accurately diagnose and repair electrical components  
\\*Maintain and protect the interior and exterior of the boat while being serviced.  
\\*Notify Division Manager of any discrepancies or problems immediately upon discovery.  
\\*Attend applicable service trainings to maintain certification & and for continuing educational requirements.  
\\*Maintain clean and orderly work environment.  
\\*Assist with boat shows and marketing.  
\\*Minimum 2+ years of marine experience or equivalent.  
\\*Benefits after 90 days and company vehicle available with experience.

We work in a fast paced ever expanding community of avid boaters and captains. Shiptronics has some of the strongest relationships with vendors and manufacturers which puts us at the forefront of the industry. Contact us today at 833-ASK-SHIP

title: Embers Restaurant Line Cook
description:
Embers Restaurant Line Cook:

Job Description:

Hay Creek Hotels is actively searching for a creative, fast-paced, and professional Line Cooks to join our Culinary Team. The Restaurant at Embers offersbreakfast, lunch and dinner 7 days a week for hotel guests and locals.

Tucked in the quaint mountain town of Blowing Rock, North Carolina, The Embers Hotel offers 36 guest rooms and suites with full-service restaurant and al frescodining patio. Managed by Hay Creek Hotels, this new-build boutique location embodies a fireside retreat with 4-star service in an approachable, natural setting.

Full-time and part-time positions available with daytime, evening, weekday and weekend shifts.

$20 per hour

Job Summary:

Learn and remain familiar with menu items and assume responsibility for all food rotation and proper timing of foods.

Work closely with the Sous Chef and Executive Chef to ensure that all items needed are in stock for the menu.

Coordinate with the Sous Chef and Executive Chef for food preparation, presentation and proper service procedures.

Maintain cleanliness of workstation, kitchen area, and walk in cooler/freezer.

Review prep list, check daily pars and maintain pars as necessary.

Prepare food of consistent quality by following recipe and production/portion standards, per check from servers.

Practice conscious knowledge of food allergies and all safety procedures.

Operate, maintain, and properly clean deep fryer, broiler, stove, steamer, food processor, mixer, slicer, oven, steam table, waffle iron and flat top grill.

Hay Creek offers an extensive benefit and incentive package, including;

Insurance Benefit package

including company-funded Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Accident, and Critical Illness plans\\*

of $25K from HCH\\*

Competitive Paid Time Off

including Vacation, Sick, Holiday Pay, and Personal Birthday\\*

Daily

Weekly payroll

schedule

with Cost of Living Adjustments and Annual Performance/Wage Reviews

Dining Discounts

at any HCH Property (50% off food for employee and guests)

About Hay Creek Hotels:

Founded in 2005, Hay Creek Hotels was created specifically to combine the intimacy of a boutique hotel with world-class cuisine, cutting-edge technology,unparalleled guest service and the exclusive amenities of a luxury inn. At Hay Creek Hotels, our passion is to pioneer superior service and inspire excitement withinthe small, independent hotel sector: to "Delight & Surprise" our guests every day. These values are driven by the idea that the best hotels and restaurants are theones that draw on the spirit, culture and character of their locales. From meticulously renovated historic properties to exciting new-build hotels, we offer some of themost unique and interesting lodging and dining destinations in the United States. Our hotels and resorts are designed to reflect their respective neighborhoods andserve as good neighbors by participating in community events and causes. Through environmentally responsible design and day-to-day management, we adhereto best practices for sustainable operations at every location.

Bringing a hyper-local focus to the hotel dining experience, the restaurants in the Hay Creek Hotels collection form deep connections with respected local farmsand providers. Our chefs seamlessly integrate their regions’ finest meats, seafood and produce with contemporary cooking styles and flavors. Each Hay Creekrestaurant is distinguished by sophisticated yet casual ambiance and cuisine that delivers both comfort and surprise with each bite. We are not the average boxhotel, and this is not the average dining experience. Dishes are created each night with the perfect balance of texture, flavor, and presentation. Farm-to-table foodbrings sensational seasonal menus with creative twists on old classics.

Our Core Values and Beliefs;

We promote and support a culture that Delights & Surprises each of our customers, associates, and business partners. Our Host Philosophy encourages eachassociate to develop the skills necessary to offer outstanding hospitality service outside the scope of their primary job responsibilities. Our Associate Promise is thecommitment to truly listen to and communicate openly and honestly with all team members. We embrace Pride Of Ownership to create an, “I can, I am, I own,”empowered approach to everything we do. Partnering in our Local Community and respecting the environment we live in are beliefs we incorporate into dailyoperations.

To learn more, visit us at

www.HayCreekHotels.com

Experience and Skills:

High School diploma or equivalent.

title: Remote Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor
description:
**Remote Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor**

**Please note** that at this time we can only work with independently **licensed providers** who have been licensed for and have **1-3+ years of experience**. If this is you, we’d love for you to meet with our recruitment team for a video interview to determine if a partnership with Grow makes sense! ! If you are in the process of obtaining these qualifications, please note that we will be unable to move forward with a meeting.

For more in-depth information on our requirements and minimum qualifications, please read the information below!

**About Grow Therapy**

Grow Therapy is a **dedicated partner for thousands of mental healthcare providers** across America. Powered by a passionate team of mental health advocates and healthcare veterans, Grow welcomes private practices to **tap into large scale referral, administrative and community support**, so that providers can **enjoy the freedom of choosing when, where and who to work with**, without the hassle of mundane admin tasks like credentialing, billing and insurance claims.

We believe everyone should have the opportunity to receive therapy, and therapists should be able to serve the communities they care most about, not just the small number of people who can afford to pay out of pocket. **Our mission is to enable providers to grow successful, independent and accessible private practices**, so that anyone can receive essential mental healthcare and create a healthier and happier America.

**Why Grow Therapy?**

We partner with our providers every step of the way:

* **Earnings:** Up to $120/hour for therapists, $135/hour for psychologists with our favorable insurance rates (and you set your own private pay rates!)
* **Weekly direct deposit based account accrual:** Don't worry about unpaid claims! Any insurance claims that you submit are guaranteed.
* **Free, hassle-free credentialing with major insurers:** Under Grow Therapy’s tax ID you’ll get paneled for free with the major payors in your state so you can work with clients who have insurance.
* **External marketing efforts to assist you in growing your practice:** We help to market your practice to potential clients
* **Intake & scheduling team dedicated to your clients:** Clients can book in a couple of easy steps, through our website or by calling our dedicated customer support team.
* **User-friendly EHR:** A one-stop shop for you to manage your invoice submissions, client notes, telehealth sessions, and scheduling in one place,
* **Autonomy:** Build the practice of your dreams by deciding your schedule, how many clients you work with, and the types of clients that you work with!
* **Telehealth:** See clients in-person or through telehealth our platform supports both!
* **Health Insurance Support:** We’ve partnered with Stride so that you can find the most affordable health care coverage plans in your area.
* **Continuing Education Credits:** Providers who actively see clients on the Grow Therapy platform can access free CEU opportunities through our partnerships with PESI and Violet
* **Grow Community:** You’ll gain access to a private community of other Grow providers who are here to offer support, advice and camaraderie during your private practice journey!
* **Clinical Education:** Gain access to clinical resources provided by our Clinical Excellence team and other like-minded clinicians such as peer consultation groups, discussion forums, documentation webinars, and more!

The best part? **Grow is free** for providers and has **no minimum visit requirements**.

Minimum Qualifications

* You are either an LPCC, LCSW, or LMFT
* Licensed in CA
* Must have independent clinical licensure for at least 1 year
* ***Please note that if you are not licensed in one of our operational states, do not hold one of the licensures listed above, an/or have not held independent licensure for one year, we will be unable to move forward with an introductory meeting.***

**Application Process**

**How can I learn more about partnering with Grow Therapy?**

* Please select “Apply Now”
* You will be prompted to complete a couple of basic screening questions
* If you meet the minimum qualifications, you will be asked to schedule an Introductory Zoom meeting with our Provider Recruitment team
* This Zoom meeting is 30 minutes
* Our team will get to know you and your practice goals and we will also tell you more about our services to see if a partnership makes sense!

CA2

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $63.00 - $120.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Work Location: Remote

title: HVAC Installer
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a skilled HVAC Installer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of heating, ventilation, air conditioning (HVAC), and refrigeration systems. This role requires a strong understanding of HVAC/R systems and the ability to work with various tools and equipment. The HVAC Installer will ensure that all installations meet industry standards and customer expectations.

**Duties**

* Install HVAC systems including air conditioners, furnaces, and refrigeration units according to specifications.
* Perform equipment repairs and maintenance on existing HVAC systems.
* Read and interpret schematics and blueprints to understand system layouts.
* Weld components as necessary to ensure proper functionality of HVAC systems.
* Plumb gas lines and other necessary connections for heating systems.
* Troubleshoot issues with HVAC/R equipment and provide effective solutions.
* Ensure compliance with safety regulations and building codes during installations.
* Maintain accurate records of work performed and materials used.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience in HVAC installation or a related field.
* Strong knowledge of ammonia refrigeration systems is preferred.
* Proficiency in equipment repair and appliance repair techniques.
* Ability to read schematics and technical drawings effectively.
* Familiarity with welding techniques as they pertain to HVAC installations.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Valid driver's license may be required for travel between job sites.

Join our dedicated team of professionals in providing top-notch HVAC solutions to our clients!

title: Transmission Technician
description:
**Now Hiring: Transmission Technician – Join a Shop That Values Your Skill, Time, and Integrity**

We’ve been in business for 35 years and are still owned and operated by the founder. The reason we opened and the reason we’ve lasted is simple: we believe in doing the right thing for both our customers and our team. We don’t cut corners. We don’t overpromise. And we don’t expect our techs to make magic without the time, tools, or support to do the job right.

About the Role:

We’re looking for a skilled, experienced Transmission Technician who takes pride in precision work and professional standards. This is not an entry-level position, we need someone who understands automatic transmissions and is confident in R&R and related diagnostics.

You’ll be working alongside a close-knit team in a 5-bay shop with modern equipment, strong workflow processes, and a relaxed but focused atmosphere. Our service advisor communicates directly and often, so there are no surprises or missing information. You’ll know what’s coming and what’s needed.

What We Offer:

* **Hourly pay** based on experience, with bonus opportunities for flag hours over 40/week
* **Monday–Friday schedule**, 8am–5pm – no evenings, weekends, or overtime
* **10 days paid time off**, **9 paid holidays**, and flexibility for family or personal needs
* **Uniforms provided and laundered**, heated shop, clean and organized workspace
* **All major tools and equipment provided** you bring your basic tools, we’ll take care of the rest
* Ongoing training opportunities and support for continued education or certification

How We Work:

* Workflow is based on communication, not chaos, service advisors are in the shop multiple times per job to support you and keep things moving
* We focus on repairs where success is likely, we don’t throw our techs into nightmare jobs for the sake of a sale
* Our customers are loyal and respectful, we work with individual vehicle owners as well as fleet accounts, and we stand behind our work

Who You Are:

* A professional technician with experience in automatic transmissions
* Someone who values a clean, honest work environment where quality is the priority
* Comfortable working independently and communicating openly
* Ready to be part of a team that supports each other and does the right thing, even when no one’s watching

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

* No weekends

* Bonus opportunities

title: Admission Hospice Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
Valley Regional Hospice Outpatient is proud to announce the opening of a full-time Registered Nurse position! With our growing needs, we are seeking a full-time RN to fit this vital role.

Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities

Patient Care

* Completes an initial, comprehensive and ongoing assessments of patient and family to determine hospice needs. Provides a complete physical assessment and history of current and previous illness(es).
* Provides professional nursing care by utilizing all elements of nursing process.
* Assesses and evaluates patient’s status by:
* Writing and initiating plan of care
* Regularly re-evaluating patient and family/caregiver needs
* Participating in revising the plan of care as necessary
* Uses health assessment data to determine nursing diagnosis.
* Develops a care plan that establishes goals, based on nursing diagnosis and incorporates palliative nursing actions. Includes the patient and the family in the planning process.
* Initiates appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures. Administers medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician in the physician’s plan of care.
* Counsels the patient and family in meeting nursing and related needs.
* Provides health care instructions to the patient as appropriate per assessment and plan.
* Assists the patient with the activities of daily living and facilitates the patient’s efforts toward self-sufficiency and optional comfort care.
* Acts as Case Manager when assigned by Clinical Supervisor and assumes responsibility to coordinate patient care for assigned caseload.

Communication

* Completes, maintains and submits accurate and relevant clinical notes regarding patient’s condition and care given. Records pain/symptom management changes/outcomes as appropriate.
* Communicates with the physician regarding the patient’s needs and reports changes in the patient’s condition; obtains/receives physicians’ orders as required.
* Communicates with community health related persons to coordinate the care plan.
* Teaches the patient and family/caregiver self-care techniques as appropriate. Provides medication, diet and other instructions as ordered by the physician and recognizes and utilizes opportunities for health counseling with patients and families/caregivers. Works in concert with the interdisciplinary group.
* Provides and maintains a safe environment for the patient.
* Assists the patient and family/caregiver and other team members in providing continuity of care.
* Works in cooperation with the family/caregiver and hospice Interdisciplinary Group Members to meet the emotional needs of the patient and family/caregiver.
* Attends interdisciplinary group meetings.

Additional Duties

* Participates in on-call duties as defined by the on-call policy.
* Ensures that arrangements for equipment and other necessary items and services

are available.

* Supervises ancillary personnel and delegates responsibilities when required.
* Assumes responsibility for personal growth and development and maintains and upgrades professional knowledge and practice skills through attendance and participation in continuing education and inservice classes.
* Fulfills the obligation of requested and/or accepted case assignments.
* Actively participates in quality assessment performance improvement teams and activities.

Position Qualifications

* Registered nurse with current licensure to practice professional nursing in the state.
* Graduate of National League for Nursing accredited school of nursing.
* Maintains a current CPR certification.
* Must be a licensed driver with an automobile that is insured in accordance with state or organization requirements and is in good working order.
* Minimum of two years’ experience, at least one of which is in the area of public health, home care, or hospice nursing is preferred.
* Self directed and able to work with minimal supervision.
* Management experience not required. Responsible for supervising hospice aides.
* Demonstrates excellent observation, problem solving, verbal and written communications; nursing skills per competency checklist.
* Shows ability to organize and prioritize workload independently.
* Prolonged or considerable walking or standing. Able to lift, position, and/or transfer patients. Able to lift supplies and equipment. Considerable reaching, stooping, bending, kneeling, and/or crouching. Visual acuity and hearing to perform required nursing skills.

title: Lead Closing Cook
description:
***The Park Inn is hiring for Lead Cook,***

***Our Way,***

We are a community driven establishment that values our staff as much as the guest. Being a part of the Park Inn community, is a gift in itself. We believe that the PI could always use and needs new faces to build what we think is one of the best establishments in the state.

***What we need,***

We are looking for someone with experience and the ability to lead a team and help build our community. A leader who is a self-motivated individual, who can motive other individuals with positivity and a willingness to learn the Park Inn way. Not afraid to speak up, take-charge, that’s responsible, reliable, follow directions when asked to do something and can so it with great attitude. If you’re looking to lead a community, with values, standards, commitment and not afraid to work hard and lead a team to success, with clear and claim instructions, then The Park Inn is the place for you.

***Job Requirements,***

***Team leader experience requirements:***

· 3 years kitchen experience, preferred 5.

· An addental 2 years of leadership as lead line/Management/Sou/Chef.

***Team leader requirements:***

· Able to communicate clearly.

· Have a general idea of labor and food cost.

· Money handling and know how to or learn to breakdown a till.

· Uphold standards and policies.

· Ensure food quality and efficiency.

· Training and development of current and new staff.

· Maintain a professional work environment.

· Complete daily tasks and one given by Management.

· Lead Line include general upkeep of the kitchen as in sweeping, mopping, all of these are nonnegotiable terms of the job.

· Coordinate with servers and bartenders on tickets and times.

· Proven leadership skills in managing kitchen staff and ensuring efficient workflow.

· Ability to handle cash transactions and basic math for inventory management.

· Excellent communication skills to coordinate with team members and provide exceptional customer service.

· Prior experience in a restaurant setting, demonstrating a solid understanding of food service industry dynamics

***Cook requirements:***

· Comfortable working in the kitchen and having the willingness to learn.

· Good communication skills, the ability to work and lead a team.

· Ability to work with high volumes, efficiently and skillfully.

· Being able to time out tickets and multiple food items to be sold all at once.

· lift upwards of 50 lbs, bend/stretch.

· Work long hours upwards of 10, stand for long periods of time.

· Will need to help cover other shifts throughout the week.

· Weekends and late nights are a must.

· All cooks wash dishes.

***Costumer service requirements:***

· Be able to answer phones and enter in an order properly.

· Deescalate problems with guests.

· Handle money and basic math skills.

As stated, before weekends and long hours are required with this position, the number of hours will vary from 35-40, Shifts will be Thursdays-Mondays and will be expected to close all shifts. There will be struggles that happen and will need to be made by you with clear and firm actions in this position. I need someone will to understand this and accept rewards as much as the failures that will come with being a leader of this establishment. Firing and hiring are not part of this job but are able to build up the team around you to get the job done, will have minor control on disciplinary actions, i.e. write ups, raises and such. Sunday- Thursday closes are 11:05pm, Friday and Saturday 1:05am, we serve food until the last minute.

**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated and skilled Lead Cook to join our restaurant. The ideal candidate will have a passion for food preparation and a strong understanding of food safety practices within the food industry. As a Lead Cook, you will play a crucial role in overseeing meal preparation, ensuring that all dishes are prepared to the highest standards and in accordance with dietary guidelines. This position requires excellent culinary skills, leadership abilities, and a commitment to delivering exceptional dining experiences.

**Responsibilities**

* Oversee daily kitchen operations, including meal preparation and cooking.
* Prepare and present high-quality dishes in accordance with established recipes and dietary requirements.
* Ensure compliance with food safety and sanitation standards at all times.
* Supervise and train kitchen staff, providing guidance on food handling and preparation techniques.
* Collaborate with the dietary department to create menus that meet nutritional needs.
* Monitor inventory levels of food supplies and assist in ordering as necessary.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the kitchen area.
* Assist in developing new recipes and improving existing ones.

***What we offer,***

· Starting pay 17.50hr, willing to pay $20hr. after a 90-day probationary (3 months) period.

· Yearly minimum wadge increase match and more based on performance.

· Monthly food bonus after the first month of employment

· Daily TIPS

· Free employee meals after 6 hours worked.

· Referral program.

· PSL.

***Location,***

107 W. 9th Ave. Spokane, WA. 99204, feel free to stop in and apply in person

title: Remote Inside Sales Representative (Nevada)
description:
**Job description**

**Overview**  
We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Phone Sales Representative to join our dynamic sales team. This role is essential in driving business growth by engaging with potential clients, understanding their needs, and offering tailored solutions. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills and a strong customer service orientation, ensuring a positive experience for our clients.

**Duties**

* Conduct outbound calls to potential customers to generate leads and promote our products/services.
* Develop and maintain relationships with existing clients through regular follow-ups and exceptional customer service.
* Identify customer needs and provide appropriate solutions, demonstrating technical knowledge of our offerings.
* Collaborate with the sales team to strategize on market approaches and improve sales techniques.
* Utilize software tools to track interactions, manage customer information, and report on sales activities.
* Stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities to effectively position our products/services.
* Participate in training sessions to enhance sales skills and product knowledge.

**Experience**

* Proven experience in sales or telemarketing.
* Proven results exceeding sales targets.
* Professional and clear verbal communication.
* Strong business development skills with a focus on customer relationship management.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English; ability to communicate complex information clearly.
* Proficiency in using software tools for managing sales processes and customer interactions.
* A background in customer service is highly desirable, showcasing the ability to understand and meet client needs.
* A keen interest in market dynamics and the ability to adapt strategies accordingly.
* Handle 100-250 dials per day
* Warm leads, 80% outbound, 20% inbound

**Compensation:**

Our compensation structure is designed so Sales Reps have an endless earning potential and we do not cap commissions! This position pays a competitive hourly rate with an aggressive commission plan, bonuses and spiffs. The average annual earnings are $70,000 and the top Sales Reps earn over $100,000 annually. Base pay and commissions paid weekly. The average weekly commissions are $700!

**Shift:** We operate Monday through Saturday 8am-8pm EST. You will work 40 hours per week (Overtime may be available). Two Saturday shifts required per month.

**Location:** This position is fully remote but you must be located in Nevada.

**Must have computer requirements before starting:**

* Windows PC running Windows 10 or 11 (**NO Macs or Chromebooks**)
* 2.1 GHz Processor or better (Intel: i5-4440 or better, AMD: Ryzen 3 or better)
* 8 GB of RAM or more
* 120+ GB SSD (recommended) or HDD, with 20 GB Available Free Space

* Integrated or connectable webcam
* Monitor with a recommended resolution of 1920x1080, minimum resolution of 1366x768

* Wired USB Headset (combination of microphone and headphone)
* Wired internet connection (Wifi is not supported)
* Google Chrome (updated version)
* Current anti-virus/spyware software installed at all times (Windows Security is fine)
* **Recommended Additions**
* PowerBar/Surge Protector
* **Internet Service Requirements:**
* Internet access provided by a cable or fiber provider
* Dial-up internet is NOT permitted
* DSL, satellite and wireless broadband is NOT permitted
* Minimum download speed of 5 mbps
* Minimum upload speed of 2 mbps
* **Make sure your computer is off S-mode**

title: Plumber
description:
**Now Hiring excellent PLUMBERS!**

LIMRIC Plumbing, Heating and Air keeps growing because we only hire the best, and our customers love us for it! We’ve been at this a long time here in Charleston. You’ve probably seen our trucks and our ads. What you don’t know is what it’s like to be a part of a team like this. How much you feel appreciated when you don’t cut corners. How much we inspire ongoing training and education. How much you can earn when you truly are the best. People often come to us looking for a job. They stay with us because they find a fulfilling career, room to grow, and opportunities to excel.

***The Role*****:**

Diagnose and repair residential plumbing systems and lead customers to informed and confident buying decisions.

***Responsibilities:***

title: Concierge
description:
**Company Description**

**About Encore Boston Harbor**

Encore Boston Harbor features 210,000 square-feet of gaming space including more than 3,000 slot machines and 240 table games. Situated on the Mystic River in Everett, Massachusetts, and connected to Boston Harbor, Encore Boston Harbor boasts 671 spacious hotel rooms, a spa, salon and fitness center, specialty retail shops, 15 dining and lounge venues and more than 50,000 square feet of ballroom and meeting spaces. The grounds feature a six-acre Harborwalk with pedestrian and bicycle paths that provide access to the waterfront, an event lawn, public art and ornate floral displays. It is the largest private, single-phase development in the history of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

 **Job Description**

**The Encore Boston Harbor Concierge** is responsible for providing exceptional service including proactively anticipating the needs of Encore guests. Concierge are committed to providing personalized services of the highest level including but not limited to: restaurant reservations, show tickets, transportation arrangements, shopping, spa & salon services and amenity and courier requests. The Concierge is held to a strict code of ethics and will always base their recommendations with the guest’s best interest in mind. The Concierge will develop and maintain relationships with key vendors and local partners. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: supporting the department strategy; maximizing opportunities for departmental success; maintaining all Encore Standards; and ensuring excellent guest and team member experience.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Ensures all Encore Boston Harbor core values and property and department standards are implemented and applied.

* Participate in the execution of short-and long-term departmental goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures; monitors and evaluates operational effectiveness; effects changes required for improvement. Identifies key drivers of success.
* Actively contributes to departmental performance, and the accuracy, confidentiality, and thoroughness of departmental policies and procedures; records and reports.
* Verifies that all applicable internal policies, federal and state laws, rules, regulations and property-wide controls are enforced within the department.
* Delivers and maintains a maximum level of service.
* Contributes to company-wide communication and best practices.
* Keeps informed of all new developments within the department.

* Balances multiple priorities simultaneously and meets deadlines, often in stressful and high-pressure situations.
* Resolves guest issues according to established policies and procedures.
* Exhibit exceptional, detailed knowledge about local shopping, entertainment, dining and business venues, as well as special local events.
* Responsible for maintaining vendor relationships with a focus on quality, consistency, and cost.
* Utilizes in-depth knowledge of all services and attractions at Encore Boston Harbor and the Greater Boston area to create unique and outstanding guest experiences.
* Works with safety as a priority and follows department and company safety standards.
* Maintains relevant knowledge of industry through continuing education and training.
* Provide guest assistance with florists, couriers, mail services, tours, tickets, reservations, ect
* Collect and provide comprehensive information and coordinate guest requests regarding hotel services, sporting events, places of interest, restaurants, theater, airline, transportation tickets, limousine rentals, sightseeing tours and any other information of interest. Handle reservations and obtain/issue tickets where applicable.
* Understand and anticipate customer’s needs and provide them with personalized solutions by suggesting activities and facilities provided by the hotel
* Performs any other job-related duties as assigned.

  
**Qualifications**

**JOB REQUIREMENTS:**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each job responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Age, Gaming and Certifications:**

21 years of age or above.

**Education and/or Experience:**

At least 2-3 years as a hotel concierge.

High school degree or equivalent required. Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience preferred.

Requires general computer skills, basic knowledge of Microsoft Office required. Candidate must have experience with planning and project management.

Must possess outstanding organizational, interpersonal, and administrative skills, as well as excellent attention to detail.

Knowledge of union as well as non-union working environments preferred.

Membership in the Les Clefs d’Or and The Greater Boston Concierge Association (GBCA) preferred.

**Language Skills:**

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret documents, such as policy and procedure manuals, maintenance instructions, and other related documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries from other employees or guests. Fluency in English. Ability to write detailed instructions and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and group situations.

Second language a plus.

**Mathematical Skills & Reasoning Ability:**

Ability to compute basic mathematical calculations. Ability to decipher various reports and create and maintain reports upon request. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.

**Physical Demands:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee is also regularly required to stand, walk, sit, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms, and to sit, climb or balance, and stoop, stretch, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. Essential responsibilities include moderate physical ability such as lift or maneuver at least thirty (30) pounds, and varied instances of standing/walking.

**Work Environment:**

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that exists while Team Members are performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate. When on the hotel floor or some back of house areas, the noise level increases to loud. Must be able to interact with internal and external guests in a professional manner.
* Due to the unpredictable nature of the hospitality/entertainment industry, Team Members must be able to work varying-schedules to reflect the business needs of the property.
* Reliable, consistent, and punctual attendance is required.

 **Additional Information**

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Chiropractic Marketing Coordinator
description:
**Accident Care Chiropractic and Massage is looking for:**

* Marketing Coordinator.
* Lakewood Area.
* Full-time or part-time employment.
* Bilingual in Spanish.
* NOT A DIGITAL ROLE.

**Salary and Benefits:**

* $40,000 base salary, depending on experience.
* Paid time off.
* Paid Holidays.
* Sick pay.
* Marketing expense reimbursements.
* Health, dental, and vision reimbursements.
* SIMPLE IRA Retirement Plan.

**Summary:**  
In this role, you will be connecting with potential referral contacts through in-person meetings with organizations such as healthcare clinics, attorneys, auto body shops, and more via cold and warm in-person calls. It is crucial to build these connections to increase new patient referrals. This position allows the coordinator the ability to connect with those in our communities to build better relationships as well as sharpen their marketing skills. We are open to any additional marketing ideas and creative options you may have and want to implement, should that be putting on community events, buying ads, social media, etc. This role largely requires the coordinator to be independent and we mainly look for results produced by the coordinator.

**Responsibilities and Tasks:**

* Self-starter and independent.
* Ability to focus on patient goals independently.
* Using sales experience to better connect and pitch to potential candidates to gain referrals.
* Communicate effectively in group gatherings and with other team members.
* Ability to connect well and quickly network with others.
* Using customer service skills to professionally speak with clients and patients.
* Using communication skills to identify and contact prospective business partners that would be beneficial to the organization.
* Consistency in connecting with prior partners to maintain a professional relationship for future services.
* Using customer service management (CRM) software to update and track information regarding follow-ups, visits, and new referrals.
* Writing weekly reports to communicate tasks completed to management.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or two years of equivalent work experience in retail, sales, and or customer service.
* Reliable transportation and license. The job requires specialists to travel constantly and consistently.
* One year of experience in Customer Service Management (CRM) and software inputting.
* Microsoft Office proficiency.
* Google Suite proficiency.
* Some knowledge about car accident processes is preferred.
* Bilingual in multiple languages preferred and needed.

**About us:**

Accident Care Chiropractic and Massage is the Pacific Northwest’s leader in Auto-Injury rehabilitation. We specialize in Chiropractic, Massage Therapy, and Physical Rehabilitation for patients who have experienced or sustained any sort of injury through an automobile accident. Our approach to treatment is a multi-modality and holistic style. We have over a decade of experience in treating injuries and over 22 locations throughout Oregon and Washington. We look to partner with our employees and grow them as professionals to better serve our communities.

  
**About Accident Care Chiropractic:**

Accident Care Chiropractic and Massage is the Pacific Northwest’s leaders in Auto-Injury rehabilitation. We specialize in Chiropractic, Massage Therapy and Physical Rehabilitation for patients who have experienced or sustained any sort of injury through an automobile accident. We have over a decade of experience in treating injuries and over 15 locations throughout Oregon and Washington. We look to partner with our employees and grow them as professionals to better serve our communities.

title: Corridor Specialist Swanton, VT - DHS CBP
description:

The Corridor Specialist supports all aspects of facility sustainment and operations management within their assigned geographic corridor. Responsibilities span acquisition support, budget management, and M&R coordination with an emphasis on accurate data reporting and real-time interface with CBP leadership.

* Familiarity with BOMR and MRO programs, TRIRIGA, SAP, and SharePoint.

title: Remote Licensed Clinical Social Worker
description:
**Remote Licensed Clinical Social Worker**

**Please note** that at this time we can only work with independently **licensed providers** who have been licensed for and have **1-3+ years of experience**. If this is you, we’d love for you to meet with our recruitment team for a video interview to determine if a partnership with Grow makes sense! ! If you are in the process of obtaining these qualifications, please note that we will be unable to move forward with a meeting.

For more in-depth information on our requirements and minimum qualifications, please read the information below!

**About Grow Therapy**

Grow Therapy is a **dedicated partner for thousands of mental healthcare providers** across America. Powered by a passionate team of mental health advocates and healthcare veterans, Grow welcomes private practices to **tap into large scale referral, administrative and community support**, so that providers can **enjoy the freedom of choosing when, where and who to work with**, without the hassle of mundane admin tasks like credentialing, billing and insurance claims.

We believe everyone should have the opportunity to receive therapy, and therapists should be able to serve the communities they care most about, not just the small number of people who can afford to pay out of pocket. **Our mission is to enable providers to grow successful, independent and accessible private practices**, so that anyone can receive essential mental healthcare and create a healthier and happier America.

**Why Grow Therapy?**

We partner with our providers every step of the way:

* **Earnings:** Up to $120/hour for therapists, $135/hour for psychologists with our favorable insurance rates (and you set your own private pay rates!)
* **Weekly direct deposit based account accrual:** Don't worry about unpaid claims! Any insurance claims that you submit are guaranteed.
* **Free, hassle-free credentialing with major insurers:** Under Grow Therapy’s tax ID you’ll get paneled for free with the major payors in your state so you can work with clients who have insurance.
* **External marketing efforts to assist you in growing your practice:** We help to market your practice to potential clients
* **Intake & scheduling team dedicated to your clients:** Clients can book in a couple of easy steps, through our website or by calling our dedicated customer support team.
* **User-friendly EHR:** A one-stop shop for you to manage your invoice submissions, client notes, telehealth sessions, and scheduling in one place,
* **Autonomy:** Build the practice of your dreams by deciding your schedule, how many clients you work with, and the types of clients that you work with!
* **Telehealth:** See clients in-person or through telehealth our platform supports both!
* **Health Insurance Support:** We’ve partnered with Stride so that you can find the most affordable health care coverage plans in your area.
* **Continuing Education Credits:** Providers who actively see clients on the Grow Therapy platform can access free CEU opportunities through our partnerships with PESI and Violet
* **Grow Community:** You’ll gain access to a private community of other Grow providers who are here to offer support, advice and camaraderie during your private practice journey!
* **Clinical Education:** Gain access to clinical resources provided by our Clinical Excellence team and other like-minded clinicians such as peer consultation groups, discussion forums, documentation webinars, and more!

The best part? **Grow is free** for providers and has **no minimum visit requirements**.

Minimum Qualifications

* You are either an LPCC, LCSW, or LMFT
* Licensed in CA
* Must have independent clinical licensure for at least 1 year
* ***Please note that if you are not licensed in one of our operational states, do not hold one of the licensures listed above, an/or have not held independent licensure for one year, we will be unable to move forward with an introductory meeting.***

**Application Process**

**How can I learn more about partnering with Grow Therapy?**

* Please select “Apply Now”
* You will be prompted to complete a couple of basic screening questions
* If you meet the minimum qualifications, you will be asked to schedule an Introductory Zoom meeting with our Provider Recruitment team
* This Zoom meeting is 30 minutes
* Our team will get to know you and your practice goals and we will also tell you more about our services to see if a partnership makes sense!

CA2

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $63.00 - $120.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Work Location: Remote

title: Loader Operator/Laborer
description:
**Job Summary**

The Plant Laborer/Part Time Loader Operator reports directly to the Production Manager and is responsible for the precast clocks, yard maintenance and cleaning, and the proper care and maintenance of all ready mix plant equipment. As part time loader will be responsible for the safe and proper handling, loading, and storage of aggregate materials.

Job Requirements

* Minimum High School Diploma or equivalent desired
* Must be able to pass a drug/alcohol screening and physical
* Must adhere to safety requirements and procedures and wearing of required safety equipment and clothing
* Must have reliable transportation and be at work at the appointed time ready to start with proper safety attire and equipment
* Punch a time clock
* Required to work Monday through Friday 8:00am to 5:00pm with an occasional Saturday
* Must be able to perform multiple tasks of sustained viewing activity at the rear of the loader utilizing mirrors while driving and manipulating equipment controls
* Must be able to use various tools and equipment in a safe manner to perform job functions

Duties

* On a daily basis, block forms will need to be set up, broke down and put away
* Assist with and perform other reasonable tasks around the general plant and yard facilities
* Assist with or perform plant maintenance and service as requested
* Monitor and report mechanical problems associated with loader, perform pre-trip and post-trip inspections
* Assist with and perform other reasonable tasks around the general plant and yard facilities

Operation and Maintenance of Equipment

* Perform maintenance on all equipment and plan
* Greasing of equipment and plant
* Safely and efficiently operate a rubber tire front end loader to lift, transport, and load bulk aggregate materials to and from various areas of plant property
* Perform and document daily equipment inspections of the loader
* Perform regular preventative maintenance of the loader including but not limited to:

- Check and maintain all fluid levels as described by the equipment manufacturer including water, oil, transmission and hydraulic fluids  
- Check and maintain tire pressure as described by the equipment manufacturer  
- Grease all hubs and other components as described by the equipment manufacturer

* Keep the loader clean both inside and out
* Load materials for customers as requested into dump trucks or onto trailers, but never into a pickup bed

Physical Demands

* Must be able to sit, stand and walk for extended periods of time often on wet, slick and/or uneven terrain or surfaces
* Must be capable of lifting, carrying and/or toting up to 75 lbs
* Must be able to bend/stoop, squat/crouch, push/pull, climb, kneel and twist
* Must be able to work both inside and outside, in heat and cold and around moving equipment
* Must be able to climb in to and out of the loader
* Must be able to manipulate all loader controls safely and accurately by pushing, pulling, squeezing and turning livers, knobs, buttons and wheels

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Pre - K Teacher Rockmart ($ 27,787.93 - $43,097.71)
description:
At Tallatoona Community Action Partnership (CAP), Inc., our mission is to assist low-income individuals and families to acquire useful skills and knowledge, to gain access to new opportunities, and to achieve self-sufficiency. Together, we have a shared purpose that every person has the opportunity to achieve his/her/their fullest potential and participate in and contribute to all aspects of life.

If you are looking for a place where you are passionate about helping people, then you are in the right place and we would love to have you join Tallatoona CAP, Inc. and be a part of our talented and passionate team.

Tallatoona CAP, Inc. is currently hiring for a Pre - K Teacher.

**JOB TITLE: Teacher - Pre K Teacher**

**CLASSIFICATION:** Full-Time/Regular

**FLSA STATUS:** Non-Exempt

**OFFICE LOCATION:** Head Start Early Child Development Center

**General Description**

Under the direction of the Center Manager, the Teacher Assistant will be responsible for planning and implementing developmentally appropriate classroom activities according to the requirements of the Head Start Performance Standards, Georgia Bright from the Start: Department of Early Care and Learning (DECAL) Rules and Regulations, and Tallatoona CAP, Inc. and develop a team approach to classroom teaching in collaboration with the Teacher.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

Responsible for classroom management and coordinating the daily activities of the classroom with the assistance of the Teacher Assistant.

Uses the program curriculum to develop lesson plans for classroom and supportive activities both indoors and outdoors to ensure individualization for child development, with the assistance of the Teacher Assistant.

With the assistance of the Teacher Assistant, maintains a clean, safe and healthy environment for the children, indoors and outdoors, in accordance with agency guidelines.

Provide constant supervision of children at all times.

With the assistance of the Teacher Assistant, conducts on-going observations and anecdotal record of children in his/her care. Uses records and screenings to develop daily and weekly lesson plans meeting the needs of the children and meeting weekly planned objectives.

Conducts home visits and parent conferences, maintains proper records within agency time frame.

Prepares information for Individual Education Programs (IEP) based on observations, in collaboration with the Teacher Assistant. Attends IEP meetings as required.

Refers to the IEP(s) for individualization on lesson plans.

Attends required training and meetings as specified by the agency.

Participate in Open House and Parent Meetings as required by supervisor.

Promotes consistent child attendance in the classroom, with the assistance of the teacher Assistant.

Articulate in defining and explaining the eight domains of learning and how the curriculum meets the domains.

Participates in recruitment activities (children and classroom volunteers) as required by supervisor.

Diaper and bathe children (if necessary) in accordance with the appropriate procedures.

Follows nutrition and health guidelines for the Family Style meals and hygiene practices (tooth brushing, hand washing etc.).

Prepares monthly parent calendar, with the assistance of the Teacher Assistant. Maintains confidential files in accordance with agency procedures.

Reports all needs related to service area delivery to the Center Manager and performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

Must be effective in both verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to plan and organize.

Must be able to attend required meetings and trainings at various locations and be able to work a flexible schedule.

Must possess leadership skills and have the ability to work with individuals inclusive of all ethnic, racial and cultural backgrounds.

Must have access to a vehicle, a valid drivers' license and maintain adequate liability Insurance.

Must be able to lift 50 pounds.

Individual with both oral and written English/Spanish bilingual skills preferred.

**Education and Experience**

Bachelor's or advanced degree in Early Childhood Education preferred or Bachelor's/advanced degree and coursework equivalent to a major (30 semester hours) relating to Early Childhood education, with experience teaching pre-school children.

Bachelor's degree and has been admitted into the Teach for America program, passed an Early Childhood content exam, such as the Praxis II,and has participated in a Teach for America summer training institute that included teaching preschool children and is currently receiving ongoing professional development and support from Teach for America's staff.

Associate's degree in Early Childhood Education or Associates degree in a related field and coursework equivalent to a major relating to Early Childhood Education, with experience teaching pre-school age children.

**Work Environment**

This job operates in a childcare environment. This role routinely requires interactions with children, parents, noisy and fast paced day to day activities. Require uses of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

**Physical Demands**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Tallatoona is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Tallatoona does not and will not discriminate in employment and/or personnel practices on the basis of race, gender, age, disability, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are also performed without regard to these items.'  
'

title: Electrical Engineers - Buildings + Places
description:
**Company Description**

**Work with Us. Change the World.**

At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

 **Job Description**

**AECOM** **is looking for 3 Electrical Engineers in our Tampa, FL office. This position will work within the Building & Places (B+P) organization and will provide engineering expertise in relation to Buildings, Facilities, and Site practices within B+P.**

***Note - this is sourcing advertisement to generate a pipeline of candidates.******If interested, please apply to this posting and we’ll contact you with next steps if qualified, and how to officially apply.***

Ideal candidates have a background and interest in vertical building development as well as the related Site development, having the ability to be part of a collaborative project team, be client-focused, and produce great works. This individual will participate in all aspects from project identification through conceptual and final designs and providing support activities during construction.

AECOM’s Buildings + Places practice includes architecture, interiors, building engineering, workplace strategy, master planning, urban planning, civil engineering, and landscape architecture. Our Tampa office includes all disciplines and regularly works across offices and the region.

The Electrical Engineer position presents an opportunity for a candidate to excel in their expertise and contribute to growing our Electrical Engineering B+P expertise and team, leadership growth, and mentoring teams. The position will also provide for growth in client relationships and internal relationships across offices and region. AECOM actively supports continued education, training, and innovations in professional development.

**Positions Available: We are accepting resumes for the following:**

* Electrical Engineer III - mid-level
* Electrical Engineer IV - mid level
* Electrical Engineer V - senior level

**The job responsibilities for the positions include, but may not be limited, the following:**

* Serving as Electrical Engineer on a variety of building and facility project types, including mid-to large size projects. Role provides the opportunity to lead and/or grow into leading project engineering.
* Able to organize workload and work independently on project-specific design tasks and lead project staff.
* Able to communicate and present with Clients and discuss/explain technical solutions to project conditions.
* Performing quality control reviews of work developed by others.
* Providing technical input to studies and design assessments, with expertise for benefit of client and/or team.
* Coordinate scope, schedule, budget in working with project managers and other senior level team members.
* Using AutoCAD and Revit, as working platforms for delivering design.
* Mentoring and providing guidance to junior level staff for specific technical design aspects and professional service.
* Provide direction to prescriptive and performance-based specifications.
* Participating in development of technical proposals (including estimates for the engineering budget and schedule)
* Reviewing permitting agency/engineering standards and regulations necessary to develop proper project design and permitting applications.
* Work closely with other departments from the AECOM project team/office, including civil, building engineering, architecture, geotechnical, traffic engineers, Federal team, landscape architects, and surveyors to provide value and partner in project opportunities.
* Participating and supporting site field investigations and construction related activities.

  
**Qualifications**

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:**

* Due to the nature of the work, US Citizenship is required.
* Valid US Driver’s License required, as a condition of employment must pass AECOM's Motor Vehicle Records review.
* **Position specific requirements are as follows:**
  + **Mid- Level Electrical Engineer III:**
    - BA/BS in Engineering plus 4 years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.
    - Registration as a Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Florida (current FL PE License), or EIT and able to register for the Principles & Practice (PE) Exam within 6 months.
  + **Mid- Level Electrical Engineer IV:**
    - BA/BS in Engineering plus 6 years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.
    - Registration as a Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Florida (current FL PE License), or able to register for the Principles & Practice (PE) Exam within 6 months.
  + **Senior Level Electrical Engineer V:**
    - BA/BS in Engineering plus 8 years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education.
    - Registration as a Licensed Professional Engineer in the State of Florida (current FL PE License).

* Demonstrated experience working on building and facility design projects for electrical engineering.
* Experience preparing calculations and design documents (reports, plans, specifications)
* Experience using AutoCAD and Revit.
* Experience using industry software utilized for electrical calculations, design, modeling, with current industry-recognized software.
* Demonstrated experience in roles/assignments leading projects, clients, and teams.

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Experience in electrical engineering and building development projects covering all aspects of building and site design – survey, design development, construction documents, construction administration, with direct experience in design and permitting of projects.
* Experience serving as electrical engineering design on a variety of building types for vertical and horizontal engineering.
* Experience with permitting projects with local AHJs and required jurisdictions related to specific projects.
* Demonstrated experience in planning and organizing tasks and teams in a deadline intensive environment.
* Experience working in large and/or complex projects/programs is beneficial.
* Experience with construction phase services for projects (field reviews, RFI and shop drawing/submittal reviews, specifications, as-builts and record drawings, etc.)

  
**Additional Information**  

* Sponsorship is not available for these positions.
* Relocation is not available for these positions
* AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel and Service Awards programs.
* All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**About AECOM**

AECOM is proud to offer comprehensive benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absences, voluntary benefits, perks, flexible work options, well-being resources, employee assistance program, business travel insurance, service recognition awards, retirement savings plan, and employee stock purchase plan.

AECOM is the global infrastructure leader, committed to delivering a better world. As a trusted professional services firm powered by deep technical abilities, we solve our clients’ complex challenges in water, environment, energy, transportation and buildings. Our teams partner with public- and private-sector clients to create innovative, sustainable and resilient solutions throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm that had revenue of $16.1 billion in fiscal year 2024. Learn more at aecom.com.

**What makes AECOM a great place to work**

You will be part of a global team that champions your growth and career ambitions. Work on groundbreaking projects - both in your local community and on a global scale - that are transforming our industry and shaping the future. With cutting-edge technology and a network of experts, you’ll have the resources to make a real impact. Our award-winning training and development programs are designed to expand your technical expertise and leadership skills, helping you build the career you’ve always envisioned. Here, you’ll find a welcoming workplace built on respect, collaboration and community—where you have the freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in your potential and are here to help you achieve it. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Marketing Success Manager
description:
At Aletheia Digital, we are guided by three core tenets: Make it Work For The Client, Provide Exceptional Customer Service, & Form Authentic Relationships. We are grounded in an “others first” mindset. That means we are driven to deliver results for our team members and clients; we serve others the way they want to be served; and we invest in building connections through relationship each and every day.

We are deeply influenced by the entrepreneurial spirit. Our team members are problem solvers by nature, looking for solutions and new ideas rather than having those solutions and ideas given to them. We learn from each other, challenge each other, and celebrate each other when we succeed.

As a Success Manager with Aletheia Digital, you will embody this philosophy by serving clients daily and partnering with your team members to ensure the work we do meets and exceeds expectations.

As a Success Manager, the key responsibilities you’ll engage in daily are:

**MAKE IT WORK FOR THE CLIENT**

* Develop effective campaigns to meet and exceed Client goals & expectations
* Provide required information to the Fulfillment team to create or manage Client campaign
* Track & Manage Client campaigns through Aletheia Digital CRM software including reporting current and future revenue and campaign platforms: i.e. Search, Display, Social, etc.
* Serve as liaison between the Fulfillment team and the Client
* Recommend incremental opportunities to grow Client’s relationship with Aletheia Digital

**PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE**

* Manage the customer experience and client satisfaction with Aletheia Digital
* Facilitate access to Client’s current account platforms (Google Business Profile, Google Analytics, Adwords, Facebook, Website, etc.)
* Monthly campaign performance review with the Client
* Utilize reporting resources, i.e. TapClicks, CallRail, etc.

**FORM AUTHENTIC RELATIONSHIPS**

* Cultivate and nurture personal relationship with the Client
* Identify and capture key personal information in Aletheia Digital CRM software
* Deliver personal touch points “Beyond the Campaign”, i.e. Birthdays, Anniversaries, Holidays, etc.

As a Success Manager, the desired or required experience we are looking for are:

**EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a Marketing, Communication, Computer Science or Digital Advertising related field preferred
* Exceptional people skills with a positive and cheerful disposition
* Must be extremely resourceful and able to make sound recommendations based on research and aggregated data efficiently
* Must be a self-starter who sets priorities, approaches new tasks with positivity and strives to execute with a high level of self-confidence, accountability, poise, maturity and interpersonal skills
* Must be able to manage the demands of completing multiple tasks under deadline
* Must be a team player who is passionate about their contribution towards delivering great work

At Aletheia Digital, we know our first customer is YOU! That is why we provide benefits that go beyond your paycheck. Creating a work environment that helps you maximize your potential is our commitment to our team members. To that end, as a Success Manager with Aletheia Digital, you can expect the following additional benefits with your employment:

**BENEFITS**

**Physical Wellness**

* Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
* On-demand Primary Care
* Teladoc

**Personal Wellness & Development**

* Holidays and PTO
* Personal & Professional Training & Development

**Financial Wellness & Security**

* 401(k)
* Long-Term Disability
* Life Insurance
* Supplementary Insurance Options

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: HR / Payroll Administrator
description:
**Company Description**

Blue & Gold Fleet has been the premier provider of ferry and water excursion services on San Francisco Bay for over 40 years, offering the famous one-hour San Francisco Bay Cruise, the 90-minute Escape from the Rock Cruise around Alcatraz Island and a Sunset Cruise.

The company provides regular ferry service to Sausalito and through its contract with the Water Emergency Transportation Authority (WETA) service to: Harbor Bay, Main Street Alameda, Oakland, Richmond, Seaplane Lagoon, South San Francisco, Vallejo, Oracle Park (for San Francisco Giants games and special events) and Chase Center (for Golden State Warriors games and special events). Blue & Gold Fleet operates a fleet of 25 vessels.

As we continue to grow, we’re looking for a detail-oriented and dependable team member to support our daily operations behind the scenes—ensuring our crews are paid accurately, on-boarded smoothly, and equipped with the tools they need to deliver top-tier service.

 **Job Description**

Specific Responsibilities:

* Enter and audit daily timecard and payroll records in ADP Workforce Now
* Ensure payroll accuracy & compliance
* Resolve payroll discrepancies
* Coordinate and process new hire paperwork and assist in facilitating onboarding experience
* Process monthly union benefit and pension contributions
* Facilitate and track mandatory training (harassment prevention, customer service and Title VI)
* Maintain training records & documentation
* Assist with scheduling based on bids/seniority
* Provide general administrative support

Rate: $32.00 - $36.00 / hour (DOE)

 **Qualifications**

We’re looking for a detail-oriented professional with strong administrative skills and a solid understanding of HR and Payroll practices. Candidate should also have:

* 3+ years of HR and Payroll administrative experience (required)
* Intermediate experience in Microsoft Excel (required)
* ADP Workforce Now experience (preferred)
* Experience working in a union environment (preferred)

  
**Additional Information**

Blue & Gold Fleet is an equal opportunity employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Our Company’s compliance with legal requirements adopted by the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”) and the California Privacy Rights Act (“CPRA”) can be viewed here.

title: Plumbing Customer Service Representative
description:
**Company Overview**

Chen Plumbing is a leading residential plumbing company proudly serving the Atlanta area since 1998. Built on a foundation of integrity, technical excellence, and genuine customer care, we’ve grown steadily over 25+ years to become a trusted name in the community. As our company continues to expand, we’re seeking dedicated professionals who share our commitment to quality and service.

**About the Role**

As a **Customer Service Representative (CSR)** at Chen Plumbing, you are the first point of contact for our customers and a key player in the day-to-day success of our operation. You’ll handle all inbound customer calls and texts, coordinate job details, communicate with our plumbing team, and ensure each customer receives timely, clear, and courteous service. This role requires strong communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Answer all incoming phone calls and respond to customer text messages promptly and professionally.
* Book service appointments, answer service-related questions, and confirm job details with customers.
* Coordinate with dispatchers and technicians to ensure smooth job scheduling and updates.
* Document all customer interactions and job notes accurately in our system.
* Follow up on open issues, reschedules, or delays and keep customers informed every step of the way.
* Address customer concerns with empathy and professionalism, escalating issues when needed.

**Minimum Requirements**

* 2–3+ years of customer service experience (plumbing or home services industry preferred).
* Reliable transportation to and from our Norcross office.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Comfortable using computers, scheduling software, and web-based messaging platforms.
* High school diploma or GED.
* Ability to sit and remain focused for extended periods.

**Benefits**

* Competitive hourly pay: $20–25/hour based on experience.
* Health insurance.
* 401(k) with 4% company match.
* Weekly pay via direct deposit.
* No on-call or weekend shifts.
* Ongoing training and career development.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 - $28.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program

Shift:

* Day shift
* Morning shift

Application Question(s):

* What is one time you had to deal with a difficult customer service situation, and how did you handle it?
