title: Perm - Dietitian - Renal (Days)
description:
**Registered Dietitians** build trusting relationships with patients and their families and utilize dietary education and planning to directly affect their patients' quality of life. Responsibilities include completing patient assessments, creating patient specific nutritional plans, and providing ongoing nutritional support.

The qualified candidate must be registered with the Commission of Dietetic Registration.

Applicant must also have current licensure in the state or at least one year of clinical nutrition experience. Experience with ESRD patient preferred.

**Essential functions would include, but not limited to, the following**:

1. Complies with all Company policies and procedures as well as federal, state, OSHA, and other agency regulations applicable to the position

2. Handles patient information with discretion and sensitivity and maintains HIPAA compliance

3. Utilizes tactful and professional communication to promote positive public relations with patients, patient family members, physicians, co-workers, outside agencies, and service providers

4. Ensures that patients receive appropriate care related to renal diet and medications from Long Term Care Facilities

5. Provides comprehensive nutritional assessments for dialysis patients, on-going instruction and counseling, monitors adherence to diet, provides nutritional educational material, and reviews monthly lab work

6. Assists with obtaining IDPN, nutritional resources and protocols

7. As a member of the Interdisciplinary Team (IDT), participates in the completion of Comprehensive Assessments and Plans of Care for all patients, including participating in care plan meetings and ensuring coordination with other service providers as needed

8. As a member of the Quality Assessment Performance Improvement (QAPI) team, participates in the facility’s Continuous Quality Improvement process. Monitors clinical indicators, attends meetings, and assists with action plans in accordance with the requirements of the QAPI Program

9. Participates in national and state programs on renal nutritional services and keeps abreast of changes

10. Reviews monthly lab work on each patient and makes changes in medications and diet orders in conjunction with the attending physician and/or protocols and in accordance with state specific regulations. Assists with managing medications per protocols (e.g., Vitamin D analogs,calcimimetics, phosphorus binders). Assists with obtaining IPN and other nutritional supplements for patients

11. Refers patients for assistance with nutritional resources such as financial assistance, community resources or in-home assistance and helps in getting nutritional supplements as needed

12. Performs job duties in accordance with all state/licensing requirements

13. Assists with other projects and assignments as requested by Clinic Leadership

14. Responsible for maintaining registration and continuing education hours as specified by the American Dietetic Association

15. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals

16. Ability to speak effectively with clients and fellow staff members

**REQUIREMENTS**

* Registered by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics on the Commission of Dietetics Registry - REQUIRED
* Current state licensure (if required by the state). Meets all applicable state/licensing requirements - REQUIRED
* Minimum of 1 year experience in clinical nutrition as a registered dietitian (after becoming a Registered Dietitian) - REQUIRED
* Member of the American Dietetic Association - Strongly Preferred
* Previous experience in nutrition associated with the ESRD patient - Preferred

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $84,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Medical Specialty:

* Dietetics

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* clinical nutrition : 1 year (Required)
* ESRD patient : 1 year (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

title: Account Executive *MUST HAVE FIBER/TELECOM SALES EXPERIENCE*
description:
**Account Executive – E WA/N ID**

**About Us**

Fatbeam Fiber, headquartered in Coeur d’Alene, Idaho, is a leading provider advancing innovation and connecting communities with reliable, scalable, and flexible fiber-based internet solutions to carrier, commercial, government/education, healthcare and residential customers. Established in 2010, Fatbeam is one of the fastest growing fiber providers in the West with 150,000+ fiber miles across eight states and 150+ cities. Offering competitive pricing and stringent service level agreements, Fatbeam makes connectivity simple! In short, we are driven, passionate, responsive and, most importantly, flexible.

**Position Summary**

The Account Executive for this position is responsible for selling Fatbeam services in our Eastern Washington/Northern ID territory. This is a field position and will work from a home office. Candidate can live in the Spokane or Coeur d'Alene area. This position will report to our VP of Sales.

**Position Responsibilities**

· Build market position by working vertical markets, developing partnerships, and being visible in the

business community

· Keep abreast of current technology trends

· Identify, contact, and build relationships with prospective customers

· Leverage the CRM system (salesforce) to develop prospecting and sales strategy that ensures high activity and effective closing ratios

· Design customized, cost-effective solutions for the client

· Manage a territory using technology, prioritization, and time management skills

· Keep CRM up to date

· Maintain open and effective lines of communication throughout the organization to maintain a sense of teamwork, enthusiasm, pride, and quality workmanship

· Share competitive analysis with sales and marketing teams

**Experience/Minimum Requirements**

· Broad experience in sales and marketing, preferably in telecommunications

· Ability to communicate professionally internally and externally

· Ability to work independently and with a team in a fast-paced environment, with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness

· Technical aptitude and strong computer skills

· Solid work ethic and good organization skills

· Must be creative and passionate about problem solving

· This is a full-time, salaried position: 40 Hours per week

· Some travel may be necessary

**Compensation and Benefits**

· Fatbeam offers market competitive total compensation packages that consists of base pay, incentive compensation for many positions, equity based long term incentive compensation and a full array of robust benefits including health insurance, FSA/HSA accounts, 401K retirement plans, paid leave, and other benefits.

· Above all, we offer a rewarding and performance-oriented culture where our employees feel valued and are part of a great team.

**Additional information**

Fatbeam requires a background check. The background check takes 3-5 days. This offer would be pending upon the results of the background check. We will also need to confirm that your driving record will not prohibit us from adding you to our insurance policy for company vehicles. Lastly, to protect our intellectual property, confidential information, and client relationships, it is our policy to require that employees execute an Employee Conduct Agreement governing these matters. Your execution of this agreement is also a condition of this offer of employment. Your employment with Fatbeam is "at will", which means that you have the right to leave your employment with us at any time while Fatbeam also reserves the right to end the employment relationship at any time.

Fatbeam is an EEO employer.

title: Medical Receptionist/Medical Assistant
description:
Are you a recent college grad with a passion for technology, but finding entry-level tech roles disappearing due to AI?

Step into a recession-proof, customer-focused healthcare role where your tech savvy and people skills can make a real difference, especially for elderly patients who value personal connection.

**About the Role:**

Washington Eye Care is seeking a bilingual receptionist (fluent in Chinese and English) who will also be cross-trained as an ophthalmic technician. You’ll be the face and voice of our clinic: greeting patients, managing check-ins, and supporting our doctors with hands-on clinical care.

This is the perfect opportunity for someone who wants:

* A stable career path in healthcare
* To stay close to technology, but in a field where humans still matter most
* To gain real-world experience in a growing medical specialty

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Front Desk:**

* Welcome patients in person and by phone with professionalism and warmth
* Schedule appointments and manage electronic medical records
* Help our patients navigate the clinic with ease
* Verify insurance, process payments, and support billing coordination

**Clinical (Training Provided):**

* Prepare patients for exams and assist with medical history intake
* Operate diagnostic equipment (autorefraction, OCT, retinal imaging)
* Work directly with our doctors to support patient care
* Learn the basics of eye anatomy, conditions, and treatments

**What We’re Looking For:**

* Fluency in Chinese (Mandarin or Cantonese) required
* Tech-savvy and comfortable learning new systems and tools
* Friendly, professional communicator
* Organized and detail-oriented with a service mindset
* No previous medical experience required, just the drive to learn

**What We Offer:**

* Full-time stable position in a respected local eye care clinic
* Hands-on training in clinical and front office skills
* Opportunities for long-term growth in healthcare
* Paid time off, health benefits, and work-life balance (no evenings!)
* A mission-driven environment where your work truly matters
* Here is what our patients say about us: https://www.zocdoc.com/doctor/benson-chen-md-ms-31890

**Why now?**

AI may be changing the tech job market, but healthcare technicians remain essential. Elderly patients need real people, not bots. If you’re ready to apply your skills in a meaningful way, this role offers purpose, security, and personal growth.

Apply today with your resume and short cover letter.

title: Social Worker
description:
Are you passionate about making a meaningful difference in the lives of older adults? We are seeking a dedicated **Social Worker** to join our interdisciplinary team at Northland PACE. PACE stands for **Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly**. If you're motivated by compassion, collaboration, and improving quality of life for seniors, we want to meet you!

As a **Social Worker** in our PACE program, you’ll play a vital role in supporting the physical, emotional, and psychosocial well-being of our participants. You will assess needs, coordinate services, advocate for care, and provide counseling to help seniors live safely and independently in their communities.

As the **social worker**, you will be responsible for:

* Conducting initial and ongoing psychosocial assessments
* Developing and implementing individualized care plans in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team
* Providing supportive counseling to participants and families
* Facilitating care coordination, referrals, and community resource linkage
* Participating in team meetings and contribute to holistic care delivery
* Ensuring documentation and compliance with PACE regulations

**Northland PACE promotes a family orientated atmosphere allowing our employees work/life balance. We have a highly competitive salaries and benefit packages.**

* Health, vision and dental coverage
* Life Insurance
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* AD&D Coverage
* Long-term Disability Coverage
* 401(k) Retirement Plan with a 1:1 match up to 5%
* PTO
* Holiday Pay
* Personal Day

title: Remote Licensed Mental Health Therapist
description:
**Remote Licensed Mental Health Therapist**

**Please note** that at this time we can only work with independently **licensed providers** who have been licensed for and have **1-3+ years of experience**. If this is you, we’d love for you to meet with our recruitment team for a video interview to determine if a partnership with Grow makes sense! ! If you are in the process of obtaining these qualifications, please note that we will be unable to move forward with a meeting.

For more in-depth information on our requirements and minimum qualifications, please read the information below!

**About Grow Therapy**

Grow Therapy is a **dedicated partner for thousands of mental healthcare providers** across America. Powered by a passionate team of mental health advocates and healthcare veterans, Grow welcomes private practices to **tap into large scale referral, administrative and community support**, so that providers can **enjoy the freedom of choosing when, where and who to work with**, without the hassle of mundane admin tasks like credentialing, billing and insurance claims.

We believe everyone should have the opportunity to receive therapy, and therapists should be able to serve the communities they care most about, not just the small number of people who can afford to pay out of pocket. **Our mission is to enable providers to grow successful, independent and accessible private practices**, so that anyone can receive essential mental healthcare and create a healthier and happier America.

**Why Grow Therapy?**

We partner with our providers every step of the way:

* **Earnings:** Up to $120/hour for therapists, $135/hour for psychologists with our favorable insurance rates (and you set your own private pay rates!)
* **Weekly direct deposit based account accrual:** Don't worry about unpaid claims! Any insurance claims that you submit are guaranteed.
* **Free, hassle-free credentialing with major insurers:** Under Grow Therapy’s tax ID you’ll get paneled for free with the major payors in your state so you can work with clients who have insurance.
* **External marketing efforts to assist you in growing your practice:** We help to market your practice to potential clients
* **Intake & scheduling team dedicated to your clients:** Clients can book in a couple of easy steps, through our website or by calling our dedicated customer support team.
* **User-friendly EHR:** A one-stop shop for you to manage your invoice submissions, client notes, telehealth sessions, and scheduling in one place,
* **Autonomy:** Build the practice of your dreams by deciding your schedule, how many clients you work with, and the types of clients that you work with!
* **Telehealth:** See clients in-person or through telehealth our platform supports both!
* **Health Insurance Support:** We’ve partnered with Stride so that you can find the most affordable health care coverage plans in your area.
* **Continuing Education Credits:** Providers who actively see clients on the Grow Therapy platform can access free CEU opportunities through our partnerships with PESI and Violet
* **Grow Community:** You’ll gain access to a private community of other Grow providers who are here to offer support, advice and camaraderie during your private practice journey!
* **Clinical Education:** Gain access to clinical resources provided by our Clinical Excellence team and other like-minded clinicians such as peer consultation groups, discussion forums, documentation webinars, and more!

The best part? **Grow is free** for providers and has **no minimum visit requirements**.

Minimum Qualifications

* You are either an LPCC, LCSW, or LMFT
* Licensed in CA
* Must have independent clinical licensure for at least 1 year
* ***Please note that if you are not licensed in one of our operational states, do not hold one of the licensures listed above, an/or have not held independent licensure for one year, we will be unable to move forward with an introductory meeting.***

**Application Process**

**How can I learn more about partnering with Grow Therapy?**

* Please select “Apply Now”
* You will be prompted to complete a couple of basic screening questions
* If you meet the minimum qualifications, you will be asked to schedule an Introductory Zoom meeting with our Provider Recruitment team
* This Zoom meeting is 30 minutes
* Our team will get to know you and your practice goals and we will also tell you more about our services to see if a partnership makes sense!

CA2

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $63.00 - $120.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Work Location: Remote

title: Information and Training Specialist Southern NV
description:
**Join us in increasing opportunities for home, community, and school success for individuals with disabilities, including those with behavioral healthcare needs.**

The **Information and Training Specialist** is generally responsible for carrying out the activities of the Educational Services Department. An **Information and Training Specialist** prepares and presents workshops, participates in outreach activities, and provides information on the laws and topics that impact children with disabilities and their families. An ideal candidate for this position is a parent, or family member of a child with a disability or behavioral healthcare needs. Other valued skills include:

* The ability to develop a good working relationship with the community organizations, diverse populations, and the general public;
* A team building attitude, ability to positively work with co-workers and volunteers;
* Experience providing non-judgmental family peer support.

**About Nevada PEP**

* PEP services are about empowering families to be life-long advocates for their children through education and skill building. PEP recognizes that parents are experts on their children; and must learn about disabilities, intervention needs, and how to develop a support system to meet those needs.
* PEP is a family of families caring, supporting and guiding one another through the challenges of raising children. When family and friends don't understand, parents always have someone to talk to at PEP. You are NOT ALONE! All of our staff has been impacted by disability in some way and know that navigating a challenging support system alone can be overwhelming.
* Over the years, not only has PEP made a difference in the individual lives of families, PEP has also made a positive impact for child and family services through community collaboration, public awareness, partnering with professionals, and system advocacy efforts.
* Nevada PEP is an equal opportunity employer, offering a comprehensive benefit plan for eligible employees.

**Benefits’ Package Include**

· Health, Dental and Vision Insurance

· Vacation

· Direct Deposit

· Paid time off on Federal Holidays + your Birthday!

title: Operations Assistant
description:
**Summary:**

The Operations Assistant (OA) is responsible for general accounting activities, procurement, and inventory control. The role provides office support in an efficient and professional manner including AP/AR, procurement of raw materials, components, and services at the appropriate price and quality within acceptable time frames. Inventory control and stock maintenance are primary objectives along with preparing and submitting customer invoices. The OA’s secondary responsibilities, include but are not limited to, answer and relay incoming calls, greet visitors, and perform diversified clerical duties. This is a multi-tasking, problem-solving position, with an emphasis on detail to constantly maintain and improve customer and vendor experience. Punctuality and good attendance are expected.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Keep internal software updated, data entry, and communicate progress to the team
* Ability to multi-task while maintaining sharp attention to detail
* Responsible for generating and submitting invoices to clients, posting payments, and making deposits
* Serve as lead point of contact for purchasing while maintaining strong vendor relationships
* Quote, process, and track orders with established outside vendors
* Ensure the timely and successful delivery of goods according to customer needs
* Responds to client and vendor inquiries such as invoices, bills, and statements, and tracking
* Collections / aging follow up through emails, calls and mailings
* Purchases raw materials, and components for custom and standard inventory, as well as production materials, office supplies, and equipment needed for daily operations
* Establishes and maintains physical inventory with periodical checks to ensure accuracy
* Prepares complete and accurate purchase orders according to company guidelines
* Coordinates with Shipping/Receiving Department pertaining to incoming and outgoing shipments
* Contacts appropriate service organization to arrange maintenance and/or service for equipment
* Post vendor invoices to jobs, seeks out new or alternate vendors when services or cost may require
* Light bookkeeping, including data entry in QuickBooks Online.
* Assist in credit card reconciliation
* Answers multiple line telephone, takes accurate messages and transfers telephone calls to the appropriate person in an efficient manner
* Receives and signs for courier deliveries and notifies appropriate personnel that packages have arrived
* Responsible for preparing outgoing mail, receives and distributes incoming mail
* Processes call in credit card payments
* Presents orders for pick up and accepts payments for processing
* Monitor multiple department emails
* Maintain W9 and tax-exempt records
* Responsible for performing other related duties as assigned
* Required to open and close the building
* Making deposits with banking institutions

**Education/Experience:**

* High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
* Three years’ related experience and/or training
* Strong verbal and written communication skills along with excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
* Knowledge of Microsoft programs: Word, Excel, Outlook and QuickBooks Online

**Knowledge, Skills, and Other Abilities:**

* Time management skills
* Oral and written communication skills
* Professionalism
* Ability to work as a team member within internal departments
* Organizational skills
* Ability to multitask
* Detailed oriented
* Ability to meet deadlines
* Prompt response times for both internal departments and external vendors / clients
* Ability to calculate figures such as discounts, tax, commissions, and percentages
* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form

**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**

* Consistent and punctual attendance is a core expectation
* Regularly required to sit; use hands and talk or hear
* Frequently required to stand and walk
* Occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, or crouch
* Must frequently lift and/or move up to 20 pounds
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, ability to adjust focus and ability to see color
* Occasionally exposed to humid conditions; work near moving mechanical parts; fumes or airborne particles and outdoor weather conditions
* The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Life insurance
* Paid time off

title: Qualified Supervising Professional (QSP)
description:
Uprise Spectrum Care LLC is seeking a dedicated and compassionate **Qualified Supervising Professional (QSP)** to join our team. This role is essential in providing high-quality support EIDBI services for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder. This role offers flexible scheduling, a supportive environment, and the opportunity to work remotely, in-person, or a combination of both.

The QSP plays a key role in maintaining clinical quality, ensuring compliance, and supporting coordination across the care team. They are responsible for reviewing and signing all initial and updated treatment plans, while also demonstrating a strong commitment to improving the quality of life for the individuals and families we serve.

**Responsibilities**

* Complete Comprehensive Multidisciplinary Evaluations (CMDE)
* Review, approve, and sign all Individual Treatment Plans (ITPs) ensure they align with DHS requirements and clinical goals
* Oversee and supervise all EIDBI services delivered by Level I, II, III providers
* Conduct weekly sessions
* Monitor clinical documentation, including case notes, data collection, and incident reports for accuracy and compliance
* Collaborate with the care team and families to ensure treatment remains consistent with client needs and family priorities
* Lead or participate in monthly staff meetings and interdisciplinary care coordination

**Qualifications**

* Meets Minnesota DHS qualifications to serve as a QSP under the EIDBI program
* Licensed in Minnesota as an LICSW, LPCC, LMFT, LP, BCBA, APRN, or Behavioral Pediatrician
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a qualifying field (e.g., Psychology, Social Work, ABA, Special Education, Nursing)
* Strong understanding of EIDBI policy and supervisory responsibilities
* Reliable, organized, and comfortable with virtual platforms
* Bilingual applicants encouraged to apply, but not required

**Schedule**

* Flexible schedule — you create your own availability
* One monthly team meeting (remote or in-person)

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals with developmental disabilities and possess the required skills, we encourage you to apply for this fulfilling opportunity.

title: Staff Pharmacist
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Staff Pharmacist to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in providing pharmaceutical care to patients in a dynamic hospital environment, including a Level I Trauma Center. This position requires expertise in clinical pharmacy practices, medication administration, and patient assessment to ensure optimal patient outcomes.

**Duties**

* Collaborate with healthcare professionals to develop and implement individualized medication therapy plans.
* Conduct thorough patient assessments to evaluate medication needs and potential interactions.
* Administer IV infusions and manage acute pain management protocols as required.
* Provide clinical pharmacy services in the Emergency Room (ER) and Intensive Care Unit (ICU).
* Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements regarding medication dispensing and administration.
* Educate patients and healthcare staff on medication use, side effects, and proper administration techniques.
* Maintain accurate records of medication orders, inventory, and patient profiles.
* Stay current with advancements in pharmacotherapy and participate in continuing education opportunities.

**Qualifications**

* Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D.) degree from an accredited institution.
* Active pharmacist license in the state of practice.
* Experience in a hospital setting, particularly within a Level I Trauma Center, is preferred.
* Strong knowledge of anatomy, clinical pharmacy practices, and medication administration protocols.
* Proficiency in IV infusion techniques and acute pain management strategies.
* Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with healthcare teams and patient education.
* Ability to assess patient needs accurately and provide compassionate care.
* Commitment to maintaining high standards of pharmaceutical care and patient safety.

Join our team as a Staff Pharmacist where you can make a significant impact on patient health outcomes through your expertise and dedication.

title: Cleaner (REF9696H)
description:
**Company Description**

**Multifamily Property Management**

 **Job Description**

The Cleaner/Housekeeper is responsible for the daily upkeep of the apartment community, including buildings, landscaping, parking lots/structures, trash, amenity and common areas, and vacated homes, and performs a range of duties to include but not limited to: cleaning/sanitizing, stocking and supplying designated facility areas (dusting, sweeping/mopping, cleaning ceiling vents, restroom cleaning, etc.); performing and documenting routine inspection and maintenance activities; and carrying out heavy cleaning tasks and special projects as assigned. The Cleaner/Housekeeper is responsible for conducting all job duties in accordance with company policy and all safety protocols, and supports the overall objective of meeting the expectations of the Client, based on the respective operating capital budget and management agreement.

* Property Name: Bella Vista At Hilltop
* 3400 Richmond Pkwy, Richmond, CA 94806, USA
* Full-Time
* Unit Count: 1008
* Driving a site-owned golf cart is a requirement for this role. Since driving a site-owned golf cart is a requirement for this role; a valid unrestricted United States Driver's License will be required.

Pay: $17.77 - $18 / Hour

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

*Job analyses will be reviewed periodically as duties and responsibilities change with business necessity. Essential and marginal (non-essential) job functions are subject to modification. Nothing in this job analysis restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities for this job.*

* Clean clubhouse/office, laundry rooms, bathrooms, models, and amenity spaces daily.
* Clean debris from grounds and all common areas daily.
* Debris which is to be disposed of includes, but is not limited to, trash, cigarette butts, pet waste, leaves along curbing and other unsightly items that will distract from the appearance of the flower beds, sidewalks, grass areas, parking lots, breezeways and dumpster enclosures. (Applicable if no Groundskeeper on property).
* Hose down pool and spa area.
* Arrange pool furniture daily in a neat and organized manner.
* Clean showers/restrooms, ash urns and trash containers.
* Clean vacant apartments after move-out. Utilize the Apartment Cleaning Checklist when turning units.
* Equipment provided for your use to complete the job will not be abused. You will maintain all equipment. Your supervisor should be informed of repair needs.

**OTHER**

* Wear provided uniform and name badge during work hours. Promote a professional image by adhering to FPI Management's Dress Code Policy.
* Provide all small hand tools necessary to perform routine maintenance (when applicable).
* Consistently and fairly enforce community rules and regulations, FPI Standard Operating Procedures.
* Comply with all Fair Housing Laws and FPI policies and procedures.
* Conduct displayed must be of a professional manner when communicating with employees, residents, prospective residents, clients, vendors, and guests while representing FPI Management.
* Responsible for meeting all training requirements for the position (Grace Hill, Safety Meetings, etc.).
* Perform any and all functions as directed by the supervisor, including special project assistance.

  
**Qualifications**

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**

* Minimum 1 year of experience in a similar role, preferably within Residential Property Management. Experience in residential, hotel, or facilities janitorial services will also be considered.
* High School diploma or equivalency certificate required.
* Must be proficient in speaking, reading, and writing in English.
* Basic computer skills (email, internet, etc.).

  
**Additional Information**

**ESSENTIAL ATTRIBUTES**

* Embracing and exemplifying our **HEART** core values and incorporating them into every task performed and every interaction with clients, supervisors, team members, colleagues, residents, vendors, etc.
* Positive influencing, interpersonal, and communication skills are essential.

**Why look at FPI for your next career step?** We are one of the largest third-party 100% fee-managed Property Management companies in the nation, an industry leader in both the Conventional and Affordable Housing spaces, managing over 850 communities (~150,000 units) across the country, and employing ~3,500 team members. We offer comprehensive compensation and benefits packages (employee-only employer-paid plan available), ongoing training, and plenty of opportunities to grow your career. Come join Team FPI!

**EEO/EVerify Statements**

FPI Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply. FPI Management participates in the E-Verify program.

title: Shelter Advocate - Second Shift
company: Violence Prevention Center of Southwestern Illinois
description:
**Overview:**

The Violence Prevention Center seeks a full-time shelter advocate to join our Emergency Shelter team. This is an opportunity for a patient, caring, and supportive professional to work with survivors of domestic violence. This position provides supportive counseling, group sessions, advocacy, crisis intervention, safety planning, information, referrals, and related services to survivors residing in the shelter.

**Responsibilities:**

· Encourages and assists clients in meeting their goals.

· Answer domestic violence crisis hotline calls and respond appropriately.

· Monitors the shelter for safety, order, and overall operations.

· Asses family needs, including discussing complex topics of abuse history, child abuse and neglect, parenting issues, and DCFS involvement with compassion and without judgment.

· Collaborate with Case Managers and additional staff to promote safety and positive outcomes for residents.

· Communicate complex topics, including Illinois Domestic Violence Act rights, the court process for Orders of Protection, and how to report violations.

· Maintain a safe, clean, and well-stocked shelter environment for residents and staff.

**Qualifications:**

· Enthusiasm for the mission of the Violence Prevention Center and the survivors we serve

· Minimum of 4 years related education/experience required.

· BA/BS in counseling, social work, or a closely related field is strongly preferred.

· Excellent oral and written communication skills.

· Ability to work and connect with diverse populations.

· Capacity to work independently while in collaboration with a team.

· Valid driver’s license, automobile insurance, and reliable transportation required.

**Hours:** This position works a regular schedule of Monday-Friday from 2:00 pm -10:00 pm. This position will occasionally fill weekend shifts when needed.

**Compensation:** This position offers a salary range of $43,000- $47,000 with a benefits package including health, dental, and life insurance, paid time off, and retirement plan options.

**About the Agency:** The Violence Prevention Center of Southwestern Illinois (VPC) works to eliminate domestic violence in individual lives and society as a whole. The agency believes that all people have the right to be free from harm, be respected, and determine and pursue their goals. Operating with these values allows the VPC to meet clients where they are and empowers survivors to heal from trauma. The VPC accomplishes this through survivor-led support services, including a 24-hour crisis hotline, counseling, legal advocacy, emergency housing, and rapid rehousing. These life-saving services are essential to the survivors of domestic violence we serve and provide clients with the best opportunities to create lasting safety and peace in their lives.

The Corridor Specialist supports all aspects of facility sustainment and operations management within their assigned geographic corridor. Responsibilities span acquisition support, budget management, and M&R coordination with an emphasis on accurate data reporting and real-time interface with CBP leadership.

* Track facility operations budgets, costs, and compliance milestones.

* Provide subject-matter guidance on field-level sustainment strategies.

* Bachelor’s degree and at least 5 years of experience in facility management or related field.
* Familiarity with BOMR and MRO programs, TRIRIGA, SAP, and SharePoint.
* Ability to coordinate sustainment planning across multiple geographic locations.
* Strong report writing, analytical, and quality control skills.

In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting the SR mission: To deliver innovative, cost-effective solutions and services that enable our customers to rapidly adapt to dynamic environments, the guiding principles of our culture. We empower our staff to work together with colleagues at all levels and be part of the decision-making process; we create transparency in our operations with our clients and employees; and we offer our people opportunities to grow and challenge themselves in meaningful ways. North Texas Triangle Gastroenterology is a healthcare facility specializing in gastroenterology services, including consultations and in-office procedures. Our team of experienced healthcare professionals is committed to improving the digestive health and overall well-being of our patients.

title: Housekeeper in Pleasant Grove, Birmingham
description:
**About the job**

Are you ready to start making money in your free time? Are you good with a mop and vacuum? Then this job is for you!

Bear Brothers Cleaning is looking for more rockstar cleaners to complement our great team! We are the fastest-growing cleaning company in North Alabama, and we want you to be a part of it!

We treat our cleaners with respect and are grateful for their hard work - and we pay accordingly ($20-$30 an hour) to show that respect! If you are a part of our team, we will do our best to take care of you and give you opportunities to better your life:

"Thank you. You guys have really taken good care of me since I started working with you guys and I really appreciate it so much. I'm very grateful for this position."

- Rockstar Cleaner

We promise if you work hard for us, we will work hard for you and do everything we can to make your life better. Our purpose is to Better Lives, and our vision is to Spread Gratitude across all of North Alabama by offering great cleans for our customers and taking great care of our cleaners and staff.

We have special cleaning checklists to make the cleaning easier for our cleaners and better for our customers.

Rockstar Opportunity

Pay is $20-$30 an hour

You make 40%-45% of each clean

Flexible schedule (you set when you want to work, and we book you clean during that time)

All tips are yours

Bonuses for 5-star reviews

Promotion opportunities

Full-time employment opportunities

Work near your home

Duties for our Rockstar Cleaners

Perform general housekeeping duties such as cleaning, sanitizing, and organizing residential and commercial spaces

Clean and sanitize bathrooms, kitchens, bedrooms, living areas, and other designated areas

Dusting furniture, sweeping, mopping, and vacuuming floors

Emptying trash bins and disposing of waste properly

Laundering and changing bed linens

Restocking supplies in bathrooms and common areas

Cleaning windows, mirrors, and glass surfaces

Adhering to housekeeping management guidelines and protocols

Requirements

1-year experience in house cleaning or commercial cleaning

Reliable car, car insurance, driver's license (you will be driving to every clean)

General liability insurance (our insurance doesn't cover contractors)

Consent to a background check

Lives in our service areas (North Alabama)

Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain cleanliness standards

Excellent customer service skills to interact with clients in a professional manner

Ability to follow instructions and work independently or as part of a team

Physical stamina to perform repetitive tasks and lift heavy objects if required

Knowledge of proper cleaning techniques and use of cleaning equipment

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as required to meet the organization's ongoing needs.

Are you ready to be our next Rockstar Cleaner? Apply today and start bettering your life with Bear Brothers

Cleaning tomorrow!

About Bear Brothers Cleaning

Bear Brothers Cleaning is a Cleaning Service in Huntsville, Alabama. Our goal is to make Huntsville, Alabama, Beary Clean. Using our 33-Step House Cleaning Checklist, we ensure we leave your home Beary Clean, or we will reclean for free! We offer cleaning services in Huntsville, Madison, Decatur, Owens Cross Roads, Elkmont, Florence, Muscle Shoals, Albertville, Russellville, and most of North Alabama. We offer residential cleaning, Airbnb cleaning, vrbo cleaning, standard cleaning, move-out cleaning, deep cleaning, apartment cleaning, commercial cleaning, post-construction cleaning, post-event cleaning, and office cleaning. Trust our background-checked, professionally experience cleaners to make your place Beary Clean.

Bear Brothers Cleaning has already been featured in local blogs such as All Things Madisonas the up-and-coming Cleaning Service in Greater Huntsville, Alabama. Bear Brothers Cleaning is dedicated to delivering 5-star service and that is quickly being shown on our Google Business Pageas our customers keep leaving 5-stars!We deeply appreciate each customer that trusts us to clean their homes, businesses, and more.

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
Impact Health Labs is seeking a skilled and dedicated ***Medical Laboratory Technician for a FULL TIME position***. The individual filling this position will work within a small group of like-minded individuals dedicated to contributing to the well-being of our clients. They accurately perform laboratory testing in accordance with established COLA standards and Standard Operating Procedures.

About Impact Health Labs:

Impacts Health Labs is a Georgetown, Texas based, independent, Veteran Owned and Operated, clinical laboratory dedicated to serving a range of clients within the Central Texas region. Our mission is to enhance the quality of care for the providers and patients we service by providing accurate results and a quick turn-around-time.

* Perform required analyzer maintenance.
* Troubleshoot, diagnose, develop a plan of action to solve and implement a solution for problems with analyzer performance. Contact a supervisor or vendor technical service if needed.
* Participate in the laboratories quality assurance by accurately calibrating laboratory equipment, analyzing quality control (QC) samples, verifying QC results, and documenting QC exceptions with the appropriate resolution.
* Prepare and validate reagents, calibrators and controls as required by SOP.
* Maintain proper supply inventory by participating in inventory management.
* Adhere to safety protocols and maintain a clean and organized laboratory environment.
* Uphold our commitment to exceptional patient care and customer service by ensuring timely and accurate delivery of test results.
* Perform other duties as may be deemed necessary by Supervisor.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* MLT or equivalent (Bachelor's degree in a laboratory science) with a minimum of 1 years laboratory experience in high complexity testing.
* Strong knowledge of laboratory procedures, techniques, and equipment used in diagnostic testing.
* Proficient in performing a variety of laboratory tests, including but not limited to Chemistry, Hematology, Microbiology, Immunology, and Molecular (PCR) testing.
* Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills to ensure accurate test results.
* Ability to work independently and efficiently in a fast-paced environment while maintaining high-quality standards.
* Good interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate effectively with medical professionals, patients, and team members.

**Job Overview**  
At Spirit ABA, we provide you with everything you need to change the lives of families with children with **ASD**.  
We are offering both **full-time** and **part-time** opportunities throughout Colorado. Great **benefits** we offer include health, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as PTO. Holiday events and team parties lends to Spirit's great **teamwork** spirit and culture! Experienced BCBAs are here to help you grow in this field and reach your career goals with us.  
We are seeking a dedicated **Behavior Technician** to join our team. As a Behavior Technician, you will play a crucial role in providing behavioral health services to individuals with developmental disabilities and autism.

* Implement individualized behavior intervention plans as directed by the BCBA.
* Assist in the assessment and development of care plans tailored to each client’s needs.

* Educate clients and their families about behavioral strategies and techniques to promote positive behavior changes.
* Maintain accurate medical documentation and progress notes in compliance with HIPAA regulations.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure consistency in treatment approaches across different environments.
* Monitor client progress and report any significant changes or concerns to the supervising BCBA.

**Qualifications**

* Experience working with children, particularly those with autism or other developmental disorders, is preferred.
* Knowledge of Applied Behavior Analysis principles and techniques is highly desirable.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport with clients and their families.
* Patience and empathy in dealing with challenging behaviors while maintaining a positive attitude.
* Ability to assist in developing care plans that meet individual client needs.
* Familiarity with medical documentation practices and HIPAA compliance is essential.

title: Arizona State Certified Caregiver
description:
Job Title: Arizona State Certified Caregiver

**PURPOSE:**

This position is responsible for creating the quality of life and experiences for our residents. On a daily occurrence, this position will assist with activities of daily living to include performing patient care activities under the supervision of the Resident Services Manager.

**Specific Duties:**

* Support clinical staff in a calm and efficient manner during acute, emergency situations.
* Bathe residents by multiple methods: shower, bed bath and perennial care.

Follow prescribed bathing protocols. A thorough bathing process includes: shampooing/washing/rinsing/drying and moisturizing of hair and body parts thoroughly.

* Dress and groom (brush hair, shave, oral hygiene, etc.) residents. Provide nail care (no clipping but filing is included); evaluating the need for podiatry support.
* Perform housekeeping duties such as making beds, empty trash, wash dishes in sink (both occupied and unoccupied) and clean up after any unusual incontinence or injury as it occurs.
* Assist with prompt communication to maintain the integrity of Resident’s private areas and building in general by notifying maintenance and housekeeping department through work orders for repair and less than sanitary conditions.
* Measure, record and report vital signs: temperature, pulse, respirations and blood pressure. Weigh residents monthly as ordered and as needed with concern for change in condition.
* Measure and record intake and output as ordered or requested by the Director of Clinical Care.
* Provide care that minimizes the risk of skin breakdown by being attentive to the resident’s hygiene, proper positioning and injury prevention. Observe and report the presence of skin breakdown to the Director of Clinical Care.
* Properly and safely lift, move, transfer and position residents in bed, wheelchairs and while using other equipment; use of gait belts for transfer assistance is mandatory.
* Maintain proper care specialist dress code as described in the Alta Vista Employee Handbook.
* Provide encouragement of socialization and engagement in activity to promote life enrichment.
* Safely aid with feeding residents as ordered, following prescribed feeding protocols. Record resident’s intake and report any changes.
* Accurately observe, recognize changes and report to the Director of Clinical Care staff in a timely fashion. Submit via both written and/or verbal communication any changes from norm, or “unusual” observations to the Resident Care Coordinator and/or the Director of Clinical Care in a timely fashion. Report accidents, with or without injury, promptly to immediate supervisor.
* Maintain an atmosphere of warmth, personal interest and positive energy toward a calm and peaceful environment. Gossiping is toxic and intolerable. Team members are empowered to insure the “home-like” environment for Residents and “professional” workplace for all Alta Vista staff by redirecting negative energies and reporting unresolved matters to the Director of Clinical Care.
* Assist each resident with their ever-changing needs due to cognitive and physical loss.

**Qualifications**

* High School diploma or equivalent
* Licensed Certified Care Giver in accordance with Arizona State Law
* Current CPR and First Aide Certificates
* Current Fingerprint Card
* Able to lift between 25 & 75 pounds
* Experience working with seniors and/or in the medical field (preferred)
* Ability to work in a team environment
* Possess written and verbal skills for effective communication in English
* Maintain an atmosphere of warmth, personal interest and positive emphasis, as well as a calm environment.
* Ability to work weekends, holidays and a flexible schedule

If you are a compassionate individual who enjoys making a difference in the lives of others, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding position.

To apply, please submit your resume highlighting your relevant experience in caregiving. Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

title: Member Experience
description:
**Member Experience**

**Apply here!!! https://jobs.gusto.com/postings/strong-pilates-member-experience-d3b70893-f6a9-4ad4-8f06-71e8462d12d5**

**Position Overview:**

This is not a JOB. This is an opportunity, a lifestyle, a vital role. As the Member Experience Associate at STRONG Pilates, your success will be measured by a combination of sales achievements and client satisfaction metrics! You will be at the forefront of our mission to transform lives. You will ensure that every member has an exceptional and personalized experience from the moment they walk through the doors. This position blends sales, customer service, and operational tasks, making it perfect for someone who is passionate about health, wellness, and client satisfaction.

**Key Responsibilities:**

● Sales & Membership: Assist clients with purchasing packages and memberships.

● Member Engagement: Greet and welcome clients, ensuring they feel comfortable and informed about our services

● Booking & Scheduling: Manage client appointments, ensuring optimal scheduling of classes. Handle any changes or cancellations with professionalism.

● Service Excellence: Maintain a deep understanding of our class offerings, benefits, and workouts. Offer informed recommendations based on client inquiries.

● Operational Support: Help maintain the cleanliness and organization of the studio, including preparation of compresses and restocking of amenities.

● Feedback & Improvement: Collect and relay member feedback to continuously improve the member experience. Participate in team meetings to discuss member insights.

● Community Engagement: Assist in organizing and executing events, workshops, and partnerships that promote STRONG in the local community.

● Support for Events: Assist in setting up and breaking down spaces for special events, ensuring a clean and organized environment throughout.

● Other duties as assigned and needed to support the overall business & team success.

**Qualifications:**

● Previous experience in a Sales role or customer service, preferably in the wellness or hospitality industry.

● Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a passion for health and wellness.

● Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail.

● Proficiency in booking and scheduling software is a plus.

● Flexibility to work weekends and evenings as needed.

**How your impact and success is measured:**

● Member satisfaction & retention

● Sales performance

● Operational efficiency

● Engagement & Initiative

● Professional Development

\\*Achieving these metrics successfully for a calendar year will open growth opportunities.

**What We Offer:**

● Competitive hourly wage, with potential for bonuses based on membership sales.

title: Concrete Mixer Driver
description:
BIR Concrete is expanding its team with a reliable and experienced Ready Mix Concrete Driver. Based in Knoxville, TN, BIR Concrete specializes in providing high quality materials and exceptional service for a wide range of construction projects. We are committed to delivering top tier results and fostering a safe and efficient work environment. If you’re a dedicated professional with a strong driving record and passion for delivering excellence, we invite you to apply and join our growing team !

**What You'll Be Doing**

* Safely operate a concrete truck to deliver ready mix concrete to various job sites.
* Perform pre-trip and post-trip inspections of the vehicle.
* Communicate effectively with dispatch and customers to ensure timely deliveries.
* Maintain accurate delivery records and logs.
* Adhere to all safety regulations and company policies.
* Require walking, sitting, pulling, pushing, and climbing to a significant degree

* Successful candidate must submit to post-offer pre-employment verification, drug/alcohol screen, and background check.

* Role operates primarily in environments where the conditions include moving mechanical equipment, inclement weather, heat, cold, humidity, and elevated noise level.
* Valid commercial driver's license (CDL) with a clean driving record.
* Strong understanding of safety protocols and regulations.
* Ability to operate and maintain a concrete truck.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills.
* High level of reliability and punctuality.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**About Pacific Rubber**

Pacific Rubber is the single-source seal solution. We are the leading provider of engineered seals, custom seals, elastomer/rubber gaskets and O-ring products. We have over 40 plus years of experience serving the semiconductor, medical, automotive, solar and consumer electronics industries. We are dedicated to providing best-in-class products, quality, and customer satisfaction.

**About the Role**

As a **Customer Experience Specialist** at Pacific Rubber, being customer centric is an integral part of your role. You will be part of the Customer Success team and dedicated to building customer loyalty and confidence by receiving and processing orders in a timely manner. You will be responsible for ensuring customer expectations are accurately determined and fully met by utilizing knowledge of products, logistics, production planning and inventory management.

The ideal candidatehas in-depth knowledge of the company's products/services and will actively engage with internal and external personnel to ensure all aspects of order management are being satisfied and executed, including customer interactions. This role reports to the Customer Success Manager. The position is located in San Carlos, CA and will be on-site.

Responsibilities:

· Provide Customer Satisfaction by interpreting orders, clarifying any discrepancies, processing orders and engaging communication with key stakeholders.

· Cultivate, develop, and continuously improve processes and strategies for customer excellence.

· Ensure order details are accurate and adhere to processes and deadlines.

· Develop and maintain customer partnerships by using a solution-based approach and proactively resolve any issues while fostering new business and support retention.

Required Qualifications:

* Decision-making skills and independent judgment.
* Excellent track record of successful Order Management
* Ability to manage customer challenges in a professional and decisive manner.
* Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
* Proficient in computer and technical skills: Microsoft Suite and an ERP System
* Excellent communication skills and fluent in English (Written & Verbal)

Desired Qualification

* Aptitude to handle unique requirements and delivering responses appropriately.
* Team player with integrity, strong interpersonal skills, and capable / willing to work in a diverse environment.
* Experience handling a high level of product offerings at a high transaction rate.
* Excellent solutions-oriented and problem-solving ability
* Customer service experience in Semiconductor, Sustainable Energy, Biotech and or Medical Manufacturing industry is preferred.

Experience and Education:

- 3-5 years of work-related or equivalent,

- Associate degree in business administration, accounting, marketing, or equivalent.

- Bachelor's Degree is Preferred.

Payrate: $55K – $70K

Position type: Salaried, Full time

Benefits: Pacific Rubber offers a comprehensive package of benefits including medical, dental, and 401k

Pacific Rubber is an equal employer opportunity company and considers qualification without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Please let us know confidentially if you need or require any special accommodations to participate in our recruiting process by emailing us at

title: Club Manager
description:
Location: Leesburg, VA Compensation: $50K-60K Job Type: Full-time Schedule: This role includes weekday evenings and weekend mornings. KidsUnited is the leading brand in early childhood development through soccer. We’re seeking a General Manager to lead presale efforts to build a core membership base and once open, foster a culture of learning and development for both the coaches and the families that attend the program. The General Manager is an outgoing, goal oriented, welcoming, and engaging leader who is focused on defining goals, training and developing their team, and delivering exceptional experiences for students, families, and staff. The role requires someone who is interested in center operations, driving sales and being a leader in staff development, curriculum delivery, and customer service. Applicants should have a passion for working with children, prior management experience, experience in membership based sales, and an outgoing personality to engage with families and create an exciting culture. Previous experience in athletics, coaching and working with children is a plus. This full-time role requires flexibility (including evenings and weekends.) The General Manager will supervise all staff and work closely with the Owner and the Franchisor. Key Responsibilities: Drive Growth & Business Performance ● Own and execute the membership sales strategy to drive consistent revenue growth - create monthly KPIs ● Analyze key business metrics (conversion rates, retention, revenue per member) to optimize performance. ● Develop and oversee local marketing & community outreach to increase brand awareness and attract new members. ● Build strategic partnerships with schools, parents' groups, and local businesses to drive leads. ● Build and maintain relationships with KidsUnited families Lead & Develop a Team ● Recruit and coach a team of highly motivated and energized staff. This includes sales associates and coaches ● Set clear performance expectations and hold the team accountable for results. Quality control to optimize the class experience ● Foster a culture of service, excellence, and enthusiasm—everyone on the team should love what they do. ● Ensure every coach delivers engaging, high-energy classes that keep kids and parents coming back. Deliver an Unmatched Customer Experience ● Be the face of KidsUnited—build strong relationships with parents and kids. ● Ensure every class is an exemplary experience with energy, engagement, and coaching excellence. ● Address parent concerns, manage feedback, and continuously improve the customer journey. ● Ensure the facility is clean, safe, and operating at the highest standard. Operational Excellence & Execution ● Own and optimize the day-to-day operations of the center. ● Manage scheduling, payroll, and inventory to maximize efficiency. ● Ensure compliance with all safety protocols and company standards. Experience & Skills Must-Have Experience & Skills: ● Sales & Business Acumen – You know how to sell, engage with parents, customers, and drive revenue. ● Customer-Obsessed Mindset – Creating the KidsUnited experience ● Kids Development – You must have a passion for working with children and families. ● Leadership & Team Development – You don't just manage—you coach, train, and bring the best out of your team. ● Strong Execution & Problem-Solving Skills – You don't just point out problems—you fix them. ● High-Energy, Hands-On Approach – You thrive in fast-paced environments and love being in the action. ● Positive Energy - You set the tone. Your presence brings warmth, enthusiasm, and positivity that uplifts kids, parents, and staff the moment they walk in.. Preferred Experience: ● Soccer background – Any personal or professional experience with soccer is a plus. ● Coaching or early childhood education – Experience working with kids in a coaching or teaching setting is highly valued, especially with ages 2–8.

title: Retail Sales - Women's Shoes - Bellevue Square
description:
Welcome to FRANKIE4, we’re an award-winning, Australian-founded footwear fashion label looking to build our team of enthusiastic Retail Assistants for our store in Bellevue. **This isn’t just any retail job,** though—this is your opportunity to join a revolutionary brand changing the way women experience footwear.

**THE ROLE**

This role is all about connecting with customers, guiding them in finding their perfect pair, and creating a shopping experience like no other.

Each day brings something new, but your commitment to exceptional customer service remains constant. You’ll need to be adaptable and thrive in a customer-first, dynamic environment.

We’re looking for individuals with natural leadership, a positive attitude, and infectious energy—people who love working with others, take pride in exceptional standards, and create a fun, high-performing, and welcoming atmosphere.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* **Customer Service Excellence** – Create an unforgettable shopping experience by engaging with customers, understanding their needs, and providing personalized recommendations.
* **Sales & Performance** – Strive for excellence by confidently assisting customers and challenging yourself to achieve your best.
* **Team Collaboration** – Be an active part of a supportive, high-energy team that works together to ensure seamless daily operations.
* **Product Knowledge** – Stay informed on product features, technology, and fit to offer expert guidance and tailored solutions.
* **Problem-Solving** – Approach customer inquiries with professionalism, finding the best solutions to create a positive experience.
* **Adaptability & Initiative** – Excel in a fast-paced environment by taking initiative, multitasking, and stepping up when needed.

**BENEFITS**

* Generous employee discount on our incredible range of shoes.
* Retail Incentive Program, rewarding your hard work and success with exciting bonuses.
* A growing range of employee benefits designed to support your personal and professional life.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment, with clear opportunities for internal growth and development.
* A values-driven culture that puts our people and customers first.
* Access to our Employee Assistance Program and Wellbeing Platform for you and your family.
* Work for an organization that loves to give back – FRANKIE4 supports Brainchild Foundation, The Cure Starts Now, and Dress for Success.

At FRANKIE4, we’re not just building a business – we’re building a community that values purpose, passion, and progress.

If you're driven to make a meaningful impact and excited by the opportunity to transform the way women experience footwear, we want to hear from you! Apply now and join us at FRANKIE4!

title: Help Desk Representative
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Helpdesk Specialist to join our team. This role is essential in providing technical support and assistance to our users, ensuring smooth operations and high levels of customer satisfaction. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in desktop support and a solid understanding of various operating systems, including Windows and Linux. You will be responsible for troubleshooting issues, managing service requests, and maintaining effective communication with users.

**Duties**

* Provide technical support for hardware and software issues across various platforms.
* Troubleshoot and resolve user problems related to desktop applications, operating systems, and computer networking.
* Utilize ticketing systems such as ServiceNow or Remedy to manage service requests efficiently.
* Assist users with setup, configuration, and maintenance of their devices.
* Document solutions and maintain knowledge base articles for common issues.
* Communicate effectively with users to understand their needs and provide timely updates on the status of their requests.
* Collaborate with other IT staff to enhance overall service delivery and improve processes.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience in desktop support or technical support roles.
* Proficiency in Windows and Linux operating systems.
* Familiarity with ServiceNow or Remedy ticketing systems is preferred.
* Strong understanding of computer networking concepts.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact with users effectively.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* A proactive approach to problem-solving with attention to detail.

Join us as a Helpdesk Specialist where you can contribute your skills while growing your career in a supportive environment.

title: Commercial Construction Operations Supervisor
description:
**REMEDI8** specializes in helping our customers navigate and maintain the complex world of safety and compliance. REMEDI8 has developed customized processes and procedures to successfully Inspect, Repair, Re-Label, and formally Report on key Life Safety issues around Fire Doors, Fire Dampers and Fire Barrier.

**Visit our website**: https://www.myremedi8.com/

**Quick Apply Here!**

https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=a4285963-aa73-4fd7-8934-05bcb5370667&ccId=9200364460472\\_2&lang=en\\_US&jobId=9200671930979\\_1&&source=EN

**Job Summary:**

The Operations Supervisor will provide hands-on leadership for technicians. They are responsible for building and strengthening each team member through proper training on repairs, reports, and customer service interactions.

The Operations Supervisor will also be responsible for providing the Operations Manager with a daily detailed report on current project status as well as hosting daily/weekly field team meetings. This position is full-time, year-round work in the field, and must be willing to travel 100%.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Coach, mentor, motivate technicians, and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work.
* Train all technicians on proper installation and repairs of each product prior to starting project and inspecting for quality control.
* Monitor weekly manpower schedules.
* Set expectations of daily productivity and quality on the job
* Review Safety Procedures and enforce standards.
* Utilize approved submittals, Spec-Data sheets, etc. to review the materials being installed.
* Drive performance so that each project is completed under budget and on schedule.
* Communicate and hit all project milestones, ensuring timely execution of projects according to plan.
* Completion of paperwork required on a typical project (i.e. electronic daily reports, safety toolbox talks, etc.) providing accurate documentation for customers code compliance.
* Collaborate with Sales and Operations Management in discussions to outline the scope of work including expectations and specifications.
* Proactively identify risks and issues and work to develop creative, client-centric, and cost-effective solutions.
* Document repairs that can’t be completed, obtain and record specifications for materials to be ordered.
* Provide guidance and coordination with multiple departments around approaches solutions, and best practices.
* Interact professionally using excellent communication skills with a diverse group of managers.
* Document specific project issues and resolutions for cumulative lessons learned.
* Assist in the development, documentation and communication of policies and standards.
* Maintaining strict accountability of all equipment and tools.

**Requirements and Preferred Experience:**

* Thorough understanding of NFPA 80, NFPA 105 and the IBC standards.
* Good record keeping and tracking of facilities repair work.
* Ability to interpret life safety drawings.
* Use common hand tools such as knives, scissors, saws, and staple guns.
* Properly maintain equipment and tools.
* Maintain professional, timely, communication with customers and coworkers.
* Professional presentation and verbal and written communication/instruction skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent collaboration skills both internally and externally.
* Self-starter, excellent listener and completes tasks independently and efficiently with limited direction.
* Strategic and critical thinking abilities in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent organization, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines daily.
* Self-directed and an ability to work with minimal supervision.
* Ability to handle stress and remain productive.
* Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Calendar.
* Ability to learn various software systems used throughout the company.
* Time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.
* Professional appearance and demeanor.
* OSHA 30, or must obtain within first 30 days.

**Physical Requirements:**

*The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

* The associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs and ladders; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk and hear.
* Must be able to lift and/or move up to 75 pounds occasionally.
* Working extended hours, including evenings and weekends may be required.

**Additional Requirements:**

* Must be 21 years of age.
* Must have a valid driver license.
* COVID vaccinations are not mandatory but preferred.
* Submit to TB test, vaccination blood tests & vaccinations (Flu, MMR, Varicella, etc.), and other mandatory vaccines.

**Perks and Benefits:**

* Medical, Dental, and vision coverage
* 401(k)/Roth with company match
* PTO (Paid Time Off) including paid holidays.

EOE, including disability/vets

title: Chiropractor
description:
**The Joint Chiropractic is seeking a Lead Doctor of Chiropractic to join our team in Las Vegas, NV. We welcome applications from both experienced and newly licensed chiropractors.**

The Joint is reinventing Chiropractic care by making quality healthcare affordable for patients seeking pain relief and ongoing wellness. Our membership plans and packages eliminate the need for insurance, and our no-appointment policy, convenient hours and locations make care highly accessible. As one of our Chiropractors, you will find that our unique operating model gives you all the support you need to focus on doing what you do best: looking after your patients. We support you with marketing, manage your insurance and deal with all of your business administration, as well as ensuring that you have the financial stability and security to think long term. The Joint Chiropractic is growing so fast that we can barely keep up our supply for the demand for our services. That does not happen with anything less than high quality care at a fair and affordable rate.

* **No Marketing Expectations for Chiropractic Staff**: Chiropractors at The Joint Chiropractic are not responsible for marketing tasks. That means no spinal screening in the mall!
* **Dedicated Marketing Experts**: Our marketing team has extensive knowledge and experience in the field.
* **Patient Acquisition**: The marketing team is responsible for bringing in new patients.
* **Social Media Management**: Our experts manage our social media presence.
* **SEO and Brand Awareness**: The team ensures optimal SEO and enhances brand awareness.
* **Focus on Patient Care**: This allows chiropractic staff to focus exclusively on patient care and patient education.
* **Updated Practice Hours:** We prioritize work-life balance with newly revised hours. Enjoy a consistent schedule: **Monday - Friday:** 9 AM - 6 PM , **Saturday & Sunday:** 10 AM - 4 PM

You will walk into an already thriving practice and business model. Due to our growth and expansion of clinics now and in the future we are accepting applications for Part-Time and Full-Time Chiropractors.

If you have a passion for chiropractic care and believe in the power of an adjustment to improve people’s quality of life, The Joint may be the right fit for you. I invite you to give me a call and at least explore it as an option.

**Benefits for Full Time Chiropractors:**

* Full Time: Flexible Schedule Options
* $85,000 minimum base salary DOE + Bonus Potential
* Medical, dental and vision insurance
* 401(K) matching
* Paid time off and holiday pay
* Lunch Breaks
* Company paid malpractice insurance
* Paid parental leave program
* Profit sharing
* License renewal reimbursement
* CEU cost allowance
* No external marketing responsibilities expected!
* Future growth opportunities
* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* Comprehensive training and ongoing education

title: Guest Service Agent
description:
**Job Opening: Guest Service Agent – PPG Place (Downtown Pittsburgh)**   
**Location:** Pittsburgh, PA (PPG Place)  
**Schedule:** Full-Time | Monday – Friday | Daylight Hours  
**Pay Rate:** Starting at $18.75 per hour

**About the Role:**

We are seeking a courteous, detail-oriented, and customer-focused **Guest Service Agent (GSA)** to be the first point of contact for tenants and visitors of PPG Place – one of Downtown Pittsburgh’s most iconic office complexes. With nearly 5,000 employees across 40 companies and hundreds of daily visitors, this role is vital to maintaining smooth and secure access to the building while ensuring an exceptional guest experience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Greet and assist all tenants and visitors with professionalism and courtesy
* Manage guest access and issue badges and passes for visitors
* Handle lost/expired badge requests and coordinate new badge issuance
* Verify access authorization for walk-in guests
* Coordinate group pre-registration for events or tenant meetings
* Assist with delivery verifications and communications with tenants
* Maintain an organized, clutter-free front desk area
* Ensure front desk equipment is operational at the start and end of each shift
* Keep tenant contact and local event information current
* Provide directions and general information about Downtown Pittsburgh
* Follow all safety, security, and emergency procedures
* Perform other duties as assigned by management

**What We’re Looking For:**

**Core Competencies:**

* Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational abilities
* Solid computer and typing skills
* Team player with a proactive attitude
* High integrity, reliability, and a polished, professional appearance
* Punctual with consistent attendance

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to sit or stand for extended periods

**Why Join Us?**

* Be a part of a professional team at one of Pittsburgh’s premier commercial properties

* Supportive, team-oriented environment

**Ready to Apply?**  
If you are passionate about providing top-tier service and thrive in a professional, people-facing role — we want to hear from you!
